 526	 public ServiceDependency(String dependentServiceId, String dependencyServiceId) {
 527	 this.dependentServiceId = dependentServiceId;
 528	 this.dependencyServiceId = dependencyServiceId;
 529	 }
 530	
 531	 public String getDependentServiceId() {
 532	 return dependentServiceId;
 533	 }
 534	
 535	 public String getDependencyServiceId() {
 536	 return dependencyServiceId;
 537	 }
 538	 }
 539	}

 295	 * @param dependencyGraph The dependency graph
 296	 * @return true if all services started successfully, false otherwise
 297	 */
 298	 private boolean startServicesInOrder(List<String> rootServices, Map<String, List<String>> dependencyGraph) {
 299	 // Start root services first
 300	 for (String serviceId : rootServices) {
 301	 ServiceInstance service = services.get(serviceId);
 302	 if (!startService(service)) {
 303	 return false;
 304	 }
 305	 }
 306	
 307	 // Start dependent services when their dependencies are ready
 308	 Map<String, CountDownLatch> serviceLatchMap = new HashMap<>();
 309	 for (String serviceId : services.keySet()) {
 310	 if (!rootServices.contains(serviceId)) {
 311	 // Count dependencies
 312	 int dependencyCount = 0;
 313	 for (ServiceDependency dependency : dependencies) {
 314	 if (dependency.getDependentServiceId().equals(serviceId)) {
 315	 dependencyCount++;
 316	 }
 317	 }
 318	
 319	 // Create latch for this service
 320	 serviceLatchMap.put(serviceId, new CountDownLatch(dependencyCount));
 321	 }
 322	 }
 323	
 324	 // Set up dependency countdown
 325	 for (ServiceDependency dependency : dependencies) {
 326	 String dependencyServiceId = dependency.getDependencyServiceId();
 327	 String dependentServiceId = dependency.getDependentServiceId();
 328	
 329	 // When a dependency is ready, count down the latch for its dependents
 330	 ServiceInstance dependencyService = services.get(dependencyServiceId);
 331	 CountDownLatch dependentLatch = serviceLatchMap.get(dependentServiceId);

 354	
 355	 executorService.submit(() -> {
 356	 try {

 8	/**
 9	 * Centralized definition of all P2P system components.
 10	 * This class serves as a single source of truth for component definitions,
 11	 * eliminating duplication between BootstrapService and P2PBootstrap.
 12	 */
 13	public class P2PComponent {
 14	 // Component IDs
 15	 public static final String TRACKER = "tracker";
 16	 public static final String INDEX_SERVER = "indexserver";
 17	 public static final String PEER = "peer";
 18	 public static final String CACHE = "cache";
 19	 public static final String CONNECTION = "connection";
 20	 public static final String DISCOVERY = "discovery";
 21	 public static final String STORAGE = "storage";
 22	 public static final String AUTH = "auth";
 23	 public static final String ALL = "all";
 24	
 25	 // Component configuration
 26	 private static final Map<String, ComponentConfig> COMPONENT_CONFIGS = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
 27	
 28	 // Dependencies between components (dependent -> dependencies)
 29	 private static final Map<String, Set<String>> COMPONENT_DEPENDENCIES = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();

 133	 /**
 134	 * Adds a dependency between components.
 135	 * 
 136	 * @param dependent The component that depends on another
 137	 * @param dependency The component that is depended upon
 138	 */
 139	 private static void addDependency(String dependent, String dependency) {
 140	 COMPONENT_DEPENDENCIES.computeIfAbsent(dependent, k -> ConcurrentHashMap.newKeySet()).add(dependency);
 141	 }

 143	 /**
 144	 * Gets the configuration for a specific component.
 145	 * 
 146	 * @param componentId The component ID
 147	 * @return The component configuration, or null if not found
 148	 */
 149	 public static ComponentConfig getConfig(String componentId) {
 150	 return COMPONENT_CONFIGS.get(componentId);
 151	 }

 153	 /**
 154	 * Gets all component configurations.
 155	 * 
 156	 * @return An unmodifiable map of component configurations
 157	 */
 158	 public static Map<String, ComponentConfig> getAllConfigs() {
 159	 return Collections.unmodifiableMap(COMPONENT_CONFIGS);
 160	 }

 164	 *

 166	 * @return The set of dependencies, or an empty set if none
 167	 */
 168	 public static Set<String> getDependencies(String componentId) {
 169	 Set<String> dependencies = COMPONENT_DEPENDENCIES.get(componentId);
 170	 return dependencies != null ? Collections.unmodifiableSet(dependencies) : Collections.emptySet();
 171	 }

 182	 /**
 183	 * Stops the specified components.
 184	 *
 185	 * @param components The components to stop
 186	 */
 187	 private static void stopComponents(Set<String> components) {
 188	 logger.info("Stopping components: " + components);
 189	
 190	 try {
 191	 // Create bootstrap service
 192	 BootstrapService bootstrap = new BootstrapService();
 193	
 194	 // Register components using P2PComponent for centralized definitions
 195	 try {
 196	 // Register all components except peer (which is handled separately)
 197	 for (Map.Entry<String, P2PComponent.ComponentConfig> entry : P2PComponent.getAllConfigs().entrySet()) {
 198	 String componentId = entry.getKey();
 199	 P2PComponent.ComponentConfig config = entry.getValue();
 200	
 201	 // Skip peer component (handled separately) and components not requested
 202	 if (componentId.equals(PEER) || 
 203	 (!components.contains(ALL) && !components.contains(componentId))) {
 204	 continue;
 205	 }
 206	
 207	 // Skip components with no class name (not meant to be registered)
 208	 if (config.getClassName() == null || config.getStartMethodName() == null || config.getStopMethodName() == null) {
 209	 continue;
 210	 }
 211	
 212	 // Register the component
 213	 bootstrap.registerService(
 214	 componentId, 
 215	 Class.forName(config.getClassName()), 
 216	 config.getStartMethodName(), 
 217	 config.getStopMethodName()
 218	 );
 219	 logger.info("Registered component for stopping: " + componentId);
 220	 }

 33	
 34	**Current Issues:**
 35	- Limited error recovery mechanisms
 36	- No proper retry logic for network operations
 37	- Inadequate exception handling
 38	- No circuit breaker patterns for failing services
 39	
 40	**Recommendations:**
 41	- Implement robust retry mechanisms with exponential backoff
 42	- Add circuit breakers to handle service failures gracefully
 43	- Improve exception handling with proper logging and recovery
 44	- Implement health checks for all services
 45	- Add monitoring and alerting capabilities
 46	
 47	### 3. Service Discovery and High Availability
 48	
 49	**Current Issues:**
 50	- No automatic service discovery
 51	- Manual configuration of tracker and index server addresses
 52	- No load balancing across multiple tracker or index server instances
 53	- No failover mechanisms

 11	/**
 12	 * Noddy implementation of the Circuit Breaker pattern to prevent cascading failures
 13	 * when a service is unavailable or experiencing issues.
 14	 * 
 15	 * The circuit breaker has three states:
 16	 * - CLOSED: Normal operation, requests are allowed through
 17	 * - OPEN: Service is considered unavailable, requests fail fast without attempting to call the service
 18	 * - HALF_OPEN: After a reset timeout, allows a limited number of test requests to determine if the service is healthy again
 19	 */
 20	public class CircuitBreaker {
 21	 private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(CircuitBreaker.class.getName());
 22	
 23	 public enum State {
 24	 CLOSED, // Normal operation
 25	 OPEN, // Circuit is open, calls fail fast
 26	 HALF_OPEN // Testing if service is back online
 27	 }
 28	
 29	 private final String name;
 30	 private final int failureThreshold;
 31	 private final long resetTimeoutMs;
 32	 private final AtomicReference<State> state = new AtomicReference<>(State.CLOSED);
 33	 private final AtomicInteger failureCount = new AtomicInteger(0);
 34	 private final AtomicLong lastFailureTime = new AtomicLong(0);
 35	
 36	 /**
 37	 * Creates a new CircuitBreaker with the specified parameters.
 38	 *
 39	 * @param name Name of this circuit breaker (for logging)
 40	 * @param failureThreshold Number of failures before opening the circuit
 41	 * @param resetTimeoutMs Time in milliseconds before attempting to reset the circuit
 42	 */
 43	 public CircuitBreaker(String name, int failureThreshold, long resetTimeoutMs) {
 44	 this.name = name;
 45	 this.failureThreshold = failureThreshold;
 46	 this.resetTimeoutMs = resetTimeoutMs;
 47	 }
 48	
 49	 /**
 50	 * Creates a new CircuitBreaker with default parameters.
 51	 *
 52	 * @param name Name of this circuit breaker
 53	 */
 54	 public CircuitBreaker(String name) {
 55	 this(name, 5, 30000); // Default: 5 failures, 30 second reset
 56	 }
 57	
 58	 /**
 59	 * Executes the given operation with circuit breaker protection.
 60	 *
 61	 * @param operation The operation to execute
 62	 * @param <T> The return type of the operation
 63	 * @return The result of the operation
 64	 * @throws Exception If the operation fails or the circuit is open
 65	 */
 66	 public <T> T execute(Callable<T> operation) throws Exception {
 67	 if (isOpen()) {
 68	 // Check if it's time to try resetting the circuit
 69	 if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastFailureTime.get() > resetTimeoutMs) {
 70	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "{0}: Moving to HALF_OPEN state", name);
 71	 state.compareAndSet(State.OPEN, State.HALF_OPEN);
 72	 } else {
 73	 // Circuit is open and reset timeout hasn't elapsed
 74	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "{0}: Circuit OPEN, failing fast", name);
 75	 throw new CircuitBreakerOpenException(name + " circuit is OPEN");
 76	 }
 77	 }
 78	
 79	 try {
 80	 // Execute the operation
 81	 T result = operation.call();
 82	
 83	 // If successful and in HALF_OPEN, reset the circuit
 84	 if (state.get() == State.HALF_OPEN) {
 85	 reset();
 86	 }
 87	
 88	 return result;
 89	 } catch (Exception e) {
 90	 // Record the failure
 91	 recordFailure(e);
 92	 throw e;
 93	 }
 94	 }
 95	
 96	 /**
 97	 * Executes the given operation with circuit breaker protection and returns a default value if the circuit is open.
 98	 *
 99	 * @param operation The operation to execute
 100	 * @param defaultValue Supplier for the default value to return if the circuit is open
 101	 * @param <T> The return type of the operation
 102	 * @return The result of the operation or the default value
 103	 * @throws Exception If the operation fails and the circuit is not open
 104	 */
 105	 public <T> T executeWithFallback(Callable<T> operation, Supplier<T> defaultValue) throws Exception {
 106	 try {
 107	 return execute(operation);
 108	 } catch (CircuitBreakerOpenException e) {
 109	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "{0}: Using fallback value due to open circuit", name);
 110	 return defaultValue.get();
 111	 }
 112	 }
 113	
 114	 /**
 115	 * Records a failure and potentially opens the circuit if the threshold is reached.
 116	 *
 117	 * @param e The exception that caused the failure
 118	 */
 119	 private void recordFailure(Exception e) {
 120	 lastFailureTime.set(System.currentTimeMillis());
 121	
 122	 // If we're already in OPEN state, no need to increment
 123	 if (state.get() == State.OPEN) {
 124	 return;
 125	 }
 126	
 127	 // Increment failure count
 128	 int failures = failureCount.incrementAndGet();
 129	 logger.log(Level.WARNING, "{0}: Failure #{1} - {2}", new Object[]{name, failures, e.getMessage()});
 130	
 131	 // If we've reached the threshold, open the circuit
 132	 if (failures >= failureThreshold) {
 133	 logger.log(Level.WARNING, "{0}: OPENING circuit after {1} failures", new Object[]{name, failures});
 134	 // Use compareAndSet to avoid race conditions when multiple threads are recording failures
 135	 state.compareAndSet(State.CLOSED, State.OPEN);
 136	 state.compareAndSet(State.HALF_OPEN, State.OPEN);
 137	 }
 138	 }
 139	
 140	 /**
 141	 * Resets the circuit breaker to the CLOSED state.
 142	 */
 143	 public void reset() {
 144	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "{0}: Resetting circuit breaker", name);
 145	 failureCount.set(0);
 146	 state.set(State.CLOSED);
 147	 }
 148	
 149	 /**
 150	 * Checks if the circuit is currently open (including HALF_OPEN state).
 151	 *
 152	 * @return true if the circuit is open, false otherwise
 153	 */
 154	 public boolean isOpen() {
 155	 return state.get() == State.OPEN || state.get() == State.HALF_OPEN;
 156	 }
 157	
 158	 /**
 159	 * Gets the current state of the circuit breaker.
 160	 *
 161	 * @return The current state
 162	 */
 163	 public State getState() {
 164	 return state.get();
 165	 }
 166	
 167	 /**
 168	 * Exception thrown when a call is attempted while the circuit is open.
 169	 */
 170	 public static class CircuitBreakerOpenException extends Exception {
 171	 public CircuitBreakerOpenException(String message) {
 172	 super(message);
 173	 }
 174	 }
 175	}

 10	public class PeerHandler implements Runnable {

 12

 38

 61

 63

 66	 out.writeUTF("FILE_NOT_FOUND");
 67	 return;

 69

 72	 logger.warning("Cannot access file: " + filePath);
 73	 out.writeUTF("FILE_NOT_FOUND");
 74	 return;
 75	 }

retryable with backoff\n public static final String RATE_LIMITED = \"RATE_LIMITED\";\n public static final String CIRCUIT_BREAKER_OPEN = \"CIRCUIT_BREAKER_OPEN\";\n \n // System errors - may require manual intervention\n public static final String SYSTEM_OVERLOAD = \"SYSTEM_OVERLOAD\";\n public static final String RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED = \"RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED\";\n }"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Based on my analysis of the codebase, I can see that there are already some good foundations for error handling and resilience, but there are several areas that need improvement. Let me create a detailed plan for enhancing the error handling and resilience mechanisms.

## Analysis and Plan

The current codebase has:
- Basic circuit breaker implementation
- Retry mechanisms with exponential backoff
- Some exception handling in network operations
- Limited recovery strategies
- Inconsistent error handling patterns
- Missing comprehensive exception categorization
- No advanced circuit breaker features (bulkhead, rate limiting)

## Detailed Implementation Plan

I'll implement the following improvements:

### 1. Enhanced Exception Handling Framework
- Create a comprehensive exception hierarchy for different failure types
- Implement proper exception categorization (retryable vs non-retryable)
- Add structured error responses with recovery suggestions

### 2. Advanced Circuit Breaker Features
- Add bulkhead pattern support
- Implement rate limiting capabilities
- Add metrics and monitoring integration
- Create circuit breaker factory for consistent configuration

### 3. Improved Retry Mechanisms
- Add jitter to prevent thundering herd
- Implement different backoff strategies (linear, exponential, custom)
- Add retry policies based on exception types
- Create async retry support

### 4. Recovery Strategies
- Implement graceful degradation patterns
- Add fallback mechanisms for critical operations
- Create service health monitoring and auto-recovery
- Add connection pooling with health checks

### 5. Enhanced Error Handling in Service Components
- Improve PeerHandler error handling
- Add resilience to TrackerHandler and IndexServerHandler
- Implement proper resource cleanup and connection management

Let me start implementing these improvements:

 105	 public <T> T executeWithFallback(Callable<T> operation, Supplier<T> defaultValue) throws Exception {

Let me create a detailed plan for enhancing the error handling and resilience mechanisms.

## Analysis and Plan

The current codebase has:
- Basic circuit breaker implementation
- Retry mechanisms with exponential backoff
- Some exception handling in network operations
- Limited recovery strategies
- Inconsistent error handling patterns
- Missing comprehensive exception categorization
- No advanced circuit breaker features (bulkhead, rate limiting)

## Detailed Implementation Plan

I'll implement the following improvements:

### 1. Enhanced Exception Handling Framework
- Create a comprehensive exception hierarchy for different failure types
- Implement proper exception categorization (retryable vs non-retryable)
- Add structured error responses with recovery suggestions

### 2. Advanced Circuit Breaker Features
- Add bulkhead pattern support
- Implement rate limiting capabilities
- Add metrics and monitoring integration
- Create circuit breaker factory for consistent configuration

### 3. Improved Retry Mechanisms
- Add jitter to prevent thundering herd
- Implement different backoff strategies (linear, exponential, custom)
- Add retry policies based on exception types
- Create async retry support

### 4. Recovery Strategies
- Implement graceful degradation patterns
- Add fallback mechanisms for critical operations
- Create service health monitoring and auto-recovery
- Add connection pooling with health checks

### 5. Enhanced Error Handling in Service Components
- Improve PeerHandler error handling
- Add resilience to TrackerHandler and IndexServerHandler
- Implement proper resource cleanup and connection management

Let me start implementing these improvements:

"p2p-common-api/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/common/exception/P2PException.java", "file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.common.exception;\n\n/**\n * Base exception class for all P2P system exceptions.\n * Provides categorization for retry logic and error handling strategies.\n */\npublic abstract class P2PException extends Exception {\n \n public enum ErrorCategory {\n /** Client errors - typically not retryable */\n CLIENT_ERROR,\n /** Server errors - potentially retryable */\n SERVER_ERROR,\n /** Network errors - retryable with backoff */\n NETWORK_ERROR,\n /** Rate limiting - retryable with exponential backoff */\n RATE_LIMIT_ERROR,\n /** System errors - may require manual intervention */\n SYSTEM_ERROR\n }\n \n public enum RecoveryStrategy {\n /** Do not retry, fail immediately */\n FAIL_FAST,\n /** Retry with linear backoff */\n RETRY_LINEAR,\n /** Retry with exponential backoff */\n RETRY_EXPONENTIAL,\n /** Retry with exponential backoff and jitter */\n RETRY_EXPONENTIAL_JITTER,\n /** Use circuit breaker pattern */\n CIRCUIT_BREAKER,\n /** Use fallback mechanism */\n FALLBACK,\n /** Require manual intervention */\n MANUAL_INTERVENTION\n }\n \n private final String errorCode;\n private final ErrorCategory category;\n private final RecoveryStrategy recoveryStrategy;\n private final boolean retryable;\n private final long retryAfterMs;\n \n protected P2PException(String message, String errorCode, ErrorCategory category, \n RecoveryStrategy recoveryStrategy, boolean retryable) {\n this(message, null, errorCode, category, recoveryStrategy, retryable, 0);\n }\n \n protected P2PException(String message, Throwable cause, String errorCode, \n ErrorCategory category, RecoveryStrategy recoveryStrategy, \n boolean retryable) {\n this(message, cause, errorCode, category, recoveryStrategy, retryable, 0);\n }\n \n protected P2PException(String message, Throwable cause, String errorCode, \n ErrorCategory category, RecoveryStrategy recoveryStrategy, \n boolean retryable, long retryAfterMs) {\n super(message, cause);\n this.errorCode = errorCode;\n this.category = category;\n this.recoveryStrategy = recoveryStrategy;\n this.retryable = retryable;\n this.retryAfterMs = retryAfterMs;\n }\n \n public String getErrorCode() {\n return errorCode;\n }\n \n public ErrorCategory getCategory() {\n return category;\n }\n \n public RecoveryStrategy getRecoveryStrategy() {\n return recoveryStrategy;\n }\n \n public boolean isRetryable() {\n return retryable;\n }\n \n public long getRetryAfterMs() {\n return retryAfterMs;\n }\n \n /**\n * Returns a structured error response that can be sent to clients.\n */\n public String getStructuredErrorResponse() {\n return String.format(\"ERROR %s %s %s retryable=%s retryAfter=%d\", \n errorCode, category, recoveryStrategy, retryable, retryAfterMs);\n }\n \n @Override\n public String toString() {\n return String.format(\"%s[code=%s, category=%s, strategy=%s, retryable=%s]: %s\",\n getClass().getSimpleName(), errorCode, category, recoveryStrategy, \n retryable, getMessage());\n {2}\", new Object[]{name, failures, e.getMessage()});\n\n // If we've reached the threshold, open the circuit\n if (failures >= failureThreshold) {\n logger.log(Level.WARNING, \"{0}: OPENING circuit after {1} failures\", new Object[]{name, failures});\n // Use compareAndSet to avoid race conditions when multiple threads are recording failures\n state.compareAndSet(State.CLOSED, State.OPEN);\n state.compareAndSet(State.HALF_OPEN, State.OPEN);\n }\n }", "old_str_start_line_number_1": 168, "old_str_end_line_number_1": 190, "new_str_1": " /**\n * Records a failure and potentially opens the circuit if the threshold is reached.\n *\n * @param e The exception that caused the failure\n */\n private void recordFailure(Exception e) {\n lastFailureTime.set(System.currentTimeMillis());\n State currentState = state.get();\n\n // If we're already in OPEN state, no need to increment\n if (currentState == State.OPEN) {\n return;\n }\n\n // In HALF_OPEN state, any failure immediately opens the circuit\n if (currentState == State.HALF_OPEN) {\n logger.log(Level.WARNING, \"{0}: Failure in HALF_OPEN state, reopening circuit - {1}\", \n new Object[]{name, e.getMessage()});\n state.compareAndSet(State.HALF_OPEN, State.OPEN);\n successCount.set(0);\n metrics.incrementCounter(\"circuitReopened\");\n return;\n }\n\n // Increment failure count in CLOSED state\n int failures = failureCount.incrementAndGet();\n logger.log(Level.WARNING, \"{0}: Failure #{1} - {2}\", new Object[]{name, failures, e.getMessage()});\n\n // If we've reached the threshold, open the circuit\n if (failures >= failureThreshold) {\n logger.log(Level.WARNING, \"{0}: OPENING circuit after {1} failures\", new Object[]{name, failures});\n if (state.compareAndSet(State.CLOSED, State.OPEN)) {\n metrics.incrementCounter(\"circuitOpened\");\n }\n }\n }"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":""},{"id":2,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"Successfully edited the file p2p-circuit/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/circuit/CircuitBreaker.java.

"file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.circuit;\n\nimport java.io.IOException;\nimport java.net.SocketException;\nimport java.net.SocketTimeoutException;\nimport java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;\nimport java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException;\nimport java.util.function.Predicate;\nimport java.util.logging.Logger;\n\n/**\n * Factory for creating and managing circuit breakers with consistent configurations.\n */\npublic class CircuitBreakerFactory {\n private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(CircuitBreakerFactory.class.getName());\n \n private static final ConcurrentHashMap<String, CircuitBreaker> circuitBreakers = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();\n \n // Default configurations for different service types\n public static class Config {\n public final int failureThreshold;\n public final long resetTimeoutMs;\n public final int successThreshold;\n public final Predicate<Exception> failureFilter;\n \n public Config(int failureThreshold, long resetTimeoutMs, int successThreshold, \n Predicate<Exception> failureFilter) {\n this.failureThreshold = failureThreshold;\n this.resetTimeoutMs = resetTimeoutMs;\n this.successThreshold = successThreshold;\n this.failureFilter = failureFilter;\n }\n }\n \n // Predefined configurations\n public static final Config NETWORK_SERVICE_CONFIG = new Config(\n 5, // 5 failures\n 30000, // 30 second reset timeout\n 3, // 3 successes to close\n e -> e instanceof IOException || e instanceof SocketException || \n e instanceof SocketTimeoutException || e instanceof TimeoutException\n );\n \n public static final Config CRITICAL_SERVICE_CONFIG = new Config(\n 3, // 3 failures (more sensitive)\n 60000, // 60 second reset timeout (longer recovery time)\n 2, // 2 successes to close\n e -> true // All exceptions trigger circuit breaker\n );\n \n public static final Config FAST_RECOVERY_CONFIG = new Config(\n 10, // 10 failures (more tolerant)\n 10000, // 10 second reset timeout (quick recovery)\n 5, // 5 successes to close\n e -> e instanceof IOException || e instanceof SocketException\n );\n \n public static final Config TRACKER_SERVICE_CONFIG = new Config(\n 5, // 5 failures\n 30000, // 30 second reset timeout\n 3, // 3 successes to close\n e -> e instanceof IOException || e instanceof SocketException || \n e instanceof SocketTimeoutException\n );\n \n public static final Config INDEX_SERVER_CONFIG = new Config(\n 3, // 3 failures (index server is critical)\n 45000, // 45 second reset timeout\n 2, // 2 successes to close\n e -> e instanceof IOException || e instanceof SocketException || \n e instanceof SocketTimeoutException\n );\n \n /**\n * Gets or creates a circuit breaker with the specified configuration.\n *\n * @param name The name of the circuit breaker\n * @param config The configuration to use\n * @return The circuit breaker instance\n */\n public static CircuitBreaker getOrCreate(String name, Config config) {\n return circuitBreakers.computeIfAbsent(name, n -> {\n logger.info(\"Creating new circuit breaker: \" + n);\n return new CircuitBreaker(n, config.failureThreshold, config.resetTimeoutMs, \n config.successThreshold, config.failureFilter);\n });\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets or creates a circuit breaker for network services.\n *\n * @param serviceName The name of the service\n * @return The circuit breaker instance\n */\n public static CircuitBreaker forNetworkService(String serviceName) {\n return getOrCreate(serviceName, NETWORK_SERVICE_CONFIG);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets or creates a circuit breaker for critical services.\n *\n * @param serviceName The name of the service\n * @return The circuit breaker instance\n */\n public static CircuitBreaker forCriticalService(String serviceName) {\n return getOrCreate(serviceName, CRITICAL_SERVICE_CONFIG);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets or creates a circuit breaker for services that need fast recovery.\n *\n * @param serviceName The name of the service\n * @return The circuit breaker instance\n */\n public static CircuitBreaker forFastRecovery(String serviceName) {\n return getOrCreate(serviceName, FAST_RECOVERY_CONFIG);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets or creates a circuit breaker for tracker service.\n *\n * @param serviceName The name of the service\n * @return The circuit breaker instance\n */\n public static CircuitBreaker forTrackerService(String serviceName) {\n return getOrCreate(serviceName, TRACKER_SERVICE_CONFIG);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets or creates a circuit breaker for index server.\n *\n * @param serviceName The name of the service\n * @return The circuit breaker instance\n */\n public static CircuitBreaker forIndexServer(String serviceName) {\n return getOrCreate(serviceName, INDEX_SERVER_CONFIG);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets an existing circuit breaker by name.\n *\n * @param name The name of the circuit breaker\n * @return The circuit breaker instance, or null if not found\n */\n public static CircuitBreaker get(String name) {\n return circuitBreakers.get(name);\n }\n \n /**\n * Removes a circuit breaker from the factory.\n *\n * @param name The name of the circuit breaker to remove\n * @return The removed circuit breaker, or null if not found\n */\n public static CircuitBreaker remove(String name) {\n CircuitBreaker removed = circuitBreakers.remove(name);\n if (removed != null) {\n logger.info(\"Removed circuit breaker: \" + name);\n }\n return removed;\n }\n \n /**\n * Resets all circuit breakers managed by this factory.\n */\n public static void resetAll() {\n logger.info(\"Resetting all circuit breakers\");\n circuitBreakers.values().forEach(CircuitBreaker::reset);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets the number of circuit breakers managed by this factory.\n *\n * @return The number of circuit breakers\n */\n public static int size() {\n return circuitBreakers.size();\n }\n \n /**\n * Clears all circuit breakers from the factory.\n */\n public static void clear() {\n logger.info(\"Clearing all circuit breakers\");\n circuitBreakers.clear();\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a circuit throws Exception {\n executeWithRetry(operation, 3, 1000, 10000, \n e -> e instanceof java.io.IOException || e instanceof java.net.SocketException);\n }\n \n /**\n * Executes the given operation with retry logic and configurable backoff strategy.\n *\n * @param operation The operation to execute\n * @param maxRetries Maximum number of retry attempts\n * @param initialBackoffMs Initial backoff delay in milliseconds\n * @param maxBackoffMs Maximum backoff delay in milliseconds\n * @param retryableExceptions Predicate to determine if an exception should trigger a retry\n * @param strategy The backoff strategy to use\n * @param <T> The return type of the operation\n * @return The result of the operation\n * @throws Exception If the operation fails after all retry attempts\n */\n public static <T> T executeWithRetry(Callable<T> operation, int maxRetries, \n long initialBackoffMs, long maxBackoffMs,\n Predicate<Exception> retryableExceptions,\n BackoffStrategy strategy) throws Exception {\n Exception lastException = null;\n int attempts = 0;\n long backoffMs = initialBackoffMs;\n \n while (attempts <= maxRetries) {\n try {\n if (attempts > 0) {\n logger.log(Level.INFO, \"Retry attempt {0} after {1}ms using {2} strategy\", \n new Object[]{attempts, backoffMs, strategy});\n }\n return operation.call();\n } catch (Exception e) {\n lastException = e;\n attempts++;\n \n \"Non-retryable exception: {0}\", e.getMessage());\n throw e;\n }\n // Use suggested retry delay if available\n if (p2pEx.getRetryAfterMs() > 0) {\n backoffMs = p2pEx.getRetryAfterMs();\n }\n }\n \n if (attempts > maxRetries || !retryableExceptions.test(e)) {\n logger.log(Level.WARNING, \"Operation failed after {0} attempts: {1}\", \n new Object[]{attempts, e.getMessage()});\n throw e;\n }\n \n "file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.util;\n\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.circuit.CircuitBreaker;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.circuit.CircuitBreakerFactory;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.common.exception.P2PException;\n\nimport java.util.concurrent.Callable;\nimport java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;\nimport java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;\nimport java.util.function.Supplier;\nimport java.util.logging.Level;\nimport java.util.logging.Logger;\n\n/**\n * Manages recovery strategies for different types of operations and failures.\n * Provides a unified interface for retry logic, circuit breakers, and fallback mechanisms.\n */\npublic class RecoveryManager {\n private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(RecoveryManager.class.getName());\n \n private static final ConcurrentHashMap<String, RecoveryStrategy> strategies = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();\n \n /**\n * Recovery strategy configuration for different operation types.\n */\n public static class RecoveryStrategy {\n public final boolean useRetry;\n public final int maxRetries;\n public final long initialBackoffMs;\n public final long maxBackoffMs;\n public final RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy backoffStrategy;\n \n public final boolean useCircuitBreaker;\n public final CircuitBreakerFactory.Config circuitBreakerConfig;\n \n public final boolean useFallback;\n \n public RecoveryStrategy(boolean useRetry, int maxRetries, long initialBackoffMs, \n long maxBackoffMs, RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy backoffStrategy,\n boolean useCircuitBreaker, CircuitBreakerFactory.Config circuitBreakerConfig,\n boolean useFallback) {\n this.useRetry = useRetry;\n this.maxRetries = maxRetries;\n this.initialBackoffMs = initialBackoffMs;\n this.maxBackoffMs = maxBackoffMs;\n this.backoffStrategy = backoffStrategy;\n this.useCircuitBreaker = useCircuitBreaker;\n this.circuitBreakerConfig = circuitBreakerConfig;\n this.useFallback = useFallback;\n }\n }\n \n // Predefined recovery strategies\n public static final RecoveryStrategy NETWORK_OPERATION_STRATEGY = new RecoveryStrategy(\n true, 3, 1000, 10000, RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy.EXPONENTIAL_JITTER,\n true, CircuitBreakerFactory.NETWORK_SERVICE_CONFIG,\n true\n );\n \n public static final RecoveryStrategy CRITICAL_OPERATION_STRATEGY = new RecoveryStrategy(\n true, 5, 500, 30000, RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy.EXPONENTIAL_JITTER,\n true, CircuitBreakerFactory.CRITICAL_SERVICE_CONFIG,\n true\n );\n \n public static final RecoveryStrategy FAST_OPERATION_STRATEGY = new RecoveryStrategy(\n true, 2, 100, 1000, RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy.LINEAR,\n false, null,\n false\n );\n \n public static final RecoveryStrategy TRACKER_OPERATION_STRATEGY = new RecoveryStrategy(\n true, 3, 1000, 15000, RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy.EXPONENTIAL_JITTER,\n true, CircuitBreakerFactory.TRACKER_SERVICE_CONFIG,\n true\n );\n \n public static final RecoveryStrategy INDEX_SERVER_STRATEGY = new RecoveryStrategy(\n true, 2, 2000, 20000, RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy.EXPONENTIAL_JITTER,\n true, CircuitBreakerFactory.INDEX_SERVER_CONFIG,\n true\n );\n \n /**\n * Registers a recovery strategy for a specific operation type.\n *\n * @param operationType The type of operation\n * @param strategy The recovery strategy to use\n */\n public static void registerStrategy(String operationType, RecoveryStrategy strategy) {\n strategies.put(operationType, strategy);\n logger.info(\"Registered recovery strategy for operation type: \" + operationType);\n }\n \n /**\n * Executes an operation with the appropriate recovery strategy.\n *\n * @param operationType The type of operation\n * @param operation The operation to execute\n * @param fallback Optional fallback supplier\n * @param <T> The return type\n * @return The result of the operation or fallback\n * @throws Exception If the operation fails and no fallback is available\n */\n public static <T> T executeWithRecovery(String operationType, Callable<T> operation, \n Supplier<T> fallback) throws Exception {\n RecoveryStrategy strategy = strategies.get(operationType);\n if (strategy == null) {\n logger.warning(\"No recovery strategy found for operation type: \" + operationType + \n \", using default network strategy\");\n strategy = NETWORK_OPERATION_STRATEGY;\n }\n \n return executeWithStrategy(operationType, operation, fallback, strategy);\n }\n \n /**\n * Executes an operation asynchronously with recovery strategy.\n *\n * @param operationType The type of operation\n * @param operation The operation to execute\n * @param fallback Optional fallback supplier\n * @param <T> The return type\n * @return CompletableFuture with the result\n */\n public static <T> CompletableFuture<T> executeAsyncWithRecovery(String operationType, \n Callable<T> operation, \n Supplier<T> fallback) {\n return CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(() -> {\n try {\n return executeWithRecovery(operationType, operation, fallback);\n } catch (Exception e) {\n throw new RuntimeException(e);\n }\n });\n }\n \n private static <T> T executeWithStrategy(String operationType, Callable<T> operation, \n Supplier<T> fallback, RecoveryStrategy strategy) throws Exception {\n Callable<T> wrappedOperation = operation;\n \n // Wrap with retry logic if enabled\n if (strategy.useRetry) {\n wrappedOperation = () -> RetryHelper.executeWithRetry(\n operation, \n strategy.maxRetries, \n strategy.initialBackoffMs, \n strategy.maxBackoffMs,\n RetryHelper.createSmartRetryPredicate(),\n strategy.backoffStrategy\n );\n }\n \n // Wrap with circuit breaker if enabled\n if (strategy.useCircuitBreaker) {\n CircuitBreaker circuitBreaker = CircuitBreakerFactory.getOrCreate(\n operationType, strategy.circuitBreakerConfig);\n \n if (strategy.useFallback && fallback != null) {\n return circuitBreaker.executeWithFallback(wrappedOperation, fallback);\n } else {\n return circuitBreaker.execute(wrappedOperation);\n }\n }\n \n // Execute without circuit breaker\n try {\n return wrappedOperation.call();\n } catch (Exception e) {\n if (strategy.useFallback && fallback != null) {\n logger.log(Level.WARNING, \"Operation failed, using fallback: {0}\", e.getMessage());\n return IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "p2p-util/src/test/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/util/ErrorHandlingResilienceTest.java", "file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.util;\n\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.circuit.CircuitBreaker;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.circuit.CircuitBreakerFactory;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.common.exception.NetworkException;\nimport dev.mars.p2pjava.common.exception.ServiceException;\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;\n\nimport java.io.IOException;\nimport java.net.SocketTimeoutException;\nimport java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;\n\nimport static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;\n\n/**\n * Test class demonstrating the improved error handling and resilience mechanisms.\n */\npublic class ErrorHandlingResilienceTest {\n \n @BeforeEach\n void setUp() {\n // Clear any existing circuit breakers\n CircuitBreakerFactory.clear();\n RecoveryManager.clearStrategies();\n \n // Re-register default strategies\n RecoveryManager.registerStrategy(\"network\", RecoveryManager.NETWORK_OPERATION_STRATEGY);\n RecoveryManager.registerStrategy(\"critical\", RecoveryManager.CRITICAL_OPERATION_STRATEGY);\n }\n \n @Test\n void testRetryWithExponentialBackoffAndJitter() throws Exception {\n AtomicInteger attempts = new AtomicInteger(0);\n \n String result = RetryHelper.executeWithRetry(() -> {\n int attempt = attempts.incrementAndGet();\n if (attempt < 3) {\n throw new IOException(\"Simulated network failure\");\n }\n return \"Success on attempt \" + attempt;\n }, 5, 100, 2000, RetryHelper.createSmartRetryPredicate(), \n RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy.EXPONENTIAL_JITTER);\n \n assertEquals(\"Success on attempt 3\", result);\n assertEquals(3, attempts.get());\n }\n \n @Test\n void testCircuitBreakerWithFallback() throws Exception {\n CircuitBreaker circuitBreaker = CircuitBreakerFactory.forNetworkService(\"test-service\");\n AtomicInteger attempts = new AtomicInteger(0);\n \n // Trigger circuit breaker to open\n for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++) {\n try {\n circuitBreaker.execute(() -> {\n attempts.incrementAndGet();\n throw new SocketTimeoutException(\"Service unavailable\");\n });\n } catch (Exception e) {\n // Expected failures\n }\n }\n \n assertTrue(circuitBreaker.isOpen());\n \n // Test fallback mechanism\n String result = circuitBreaker.executeWithFallback(() -> {\n throw new IOException(\"Still failing\");\n }, () -> \"Fallback response\");\n \n assertEquals(\"Fallback response\", result);\n }\n \n @Test\n void testRecoveryManagerWithNetworkStrategy() throws Exception {\n AtomicInteger attempts = new AtomicInteger(0);\n \n String result = RecoveryManager.executeWithRecovery(\"network\", () -> {\n int attempt = attempts.incrementAndGet();\n if (attempt < 2) {\n throw new NetworkException(\"Network timeout\");\n }\n return \"Network operation succeeded\";\n }, () -> \"Network fallback\");\n \n assertEquals(\"Network operation succeeded\", result);\n assertTrue(attempts.get() >= 2);\n }\n \n @Test\n void testRecoveryManagerWithFallback() throws Exception {\n AtomicInteger attempts = new AtomicInteger(0);\n \n String result = RecoveryManager.executeWithRecovery(\"critical\", () -> {\n attempts.incrementAndGet();\n throw new ServiceException.ServiceUnavailableException(\"Service down\");\n }, () -> \"Critical service fallback\");\n \n assertEquals(\"Critical service fallback\", result);\n assertTrue(attempts.get() > 0);\n }\n \n @Test\n void testP2PExceptionRetryGuidance() throws Exception {\n AtomicInteger attempts = new AtomicInteger(0);\n \n // Test non-retryable exception\n assertThrows(ServiceException.class, () -> {\n RetryHelper.executeWithRetry(() -> {\n attempts.incrementAndGet();\n throw new ServiceException.InternalServerException(\"Non-retryable error\");\n }, 3, 100, 1000, RetryHelper.createSmartRetryPredicate());\n });\n \n // Should only attempt once for non-retryable exception\n assertEquals(1, attempts.get());\n }\n \n @Test\n void testCircuitBreakerHalfOpenState() throws Exception {\n CircuitBreaker circuitBreaker = new CircuitBreaker(\"half-open-test\", 2, 100, 2, \n e -> e instanceof IOException);\n AtomicInteger attempts = new AtomicInteger(0);\n \n // Open the circuit\n for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {\n try {\n circuitBreaker.execute(() -> {\n throw new IOException(\"Failure \" + attempts.incrementAndGet());\n });\n } catch (Exception e) {\n // Expected\n }\n }\n \n assertTrue(circuitBreaker.isOpen());\n \n // Wait for reset timeout\n Thread.sleep(150);\n \n // First call should move to HALF_OPEN\n try {\n circuitBreaker.execute(() -> {\n throw new IOException(\"Still failing\");\n });\n } catch (Exception e) {\n // Expected - should reopen circuit\n }\n \n assertTrue(circuitBreaker.isOpen());\n }\n \n @Test\n void testSmartRetryPredicate() {\n var predicate = RetryHelper.createSmartRetryPredicate();\n \n // Should retry network exceptions\n assertTrue(predicate.test(new IOException(\"Network error\")));\n assertTrue(predicate.test(new SocketTimeoutException(\"Timeout\")));\n \n // Should retry retryable P2P exceptions\n assertTrue(predicate.test(new NetworkException(\"P2P network error\")));\n \n // Should not retry non-retryable P2P exceptions\n assertFalse(predicate.test(new ServiceException.InternalServerException(\"Internal error\")));\n \n // Should not retry unknown exceptions\n assertFalse(predicate.test(new IllegalArgumentException(\"Invalid argument\")));\n }\n \n @Test\n void testBackoffStrategies() throws Exception {\n // Test different backoff strategies\n for (RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy strategy : RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy.values()) {\n AtomicInteger attempts = new AtomicInteger(0);\n \n try {\n RetryHelper.executeWithRetry(() -> {\n int attempt = attempts.incrementAndGet();\n if (attempt < 3) {\n throw new IOException(\"Failure \" + attempt);\n }\n return \"Success with \" + strategy;\n }, 5, 50, 1000, e -> e instanceof IOException, strategy);\n } catch (Exception e) {\n // Some strategies might not succeed within the retry limit\n }\n \n assertTrue(attempts.get() >= 1, \"Strategy \" + strategy + \" should have attempted at least once\");\n }\n }\n \n @Test\n void testAsyncRecoveryExecution() throws Exception {\n AtomicInteger attempts = new AtomicInteger(0);\n \n var future = RecoveryManager.executeAsyncWithRecovery(\"fast\", () -> {\n int attempt = attempts.incrementAndGet();\n if (attempt < 2) {\n throw new IOException(\"Async failure\");\n }\n return \"Async success\";\n }, () -> \"Async fallback\");\n \n String result = future.get();\n assertEquals(\"Async success\", result);\n assertTrue(attempts.get() >= 2);\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a comprehensive test to IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "docs/Error-Handling-and-Resilience-Improvements.md", "file_content": "# Error Handling and Resilience Improvements\n\n## Overview\n\nThis document outlines the comprehensive improvements made to error handling and resilience mechanisms in the P2P Java project. The enhancements focus on implementing robust retry mechanisms with exponential backoff, advanced circuit breakers for handling service failures, and improved exception handling with proper recovery strategies.\n\n## 1. Enhanced Exception Hierarchy\n\n### New Exception Framework\n- **P2PException**: Base exception class with categorization for retry logic\n- **NetworkException**: For network-related errors (typically retryable)\n- **ServiceException**: For service-related errors (may be retryable)\n- **ClientException**: For client errors (typically not retryable)\n\n### Key Features\n- **Error Categorization**: Exceptions are categorized by type (CLIENT_ERROR, SERVER_ERROR, NETWORK_ERROR, etc.)\n- **Recovery Strategy Guidance**: Each exception includes suggested recovery strategies\n- **Retry Guidance**: Built-in retry recommendations with specific delays\n- **Structured Error Responses**: Standardized error format for client communication\n\n### Example Usage\n```java\ntry {\n // Some operation\n} catch (NetworkException.TimeoutException e) {\n // This exception is automatically retryable with exponential backoff\n if (e.isRetryable()) {\n // Retry logic will be handled automatically\n }\n}\n```\n\n## 2. Advanced Circuit Breaker Implementation\n\n### Enhanced Features\n- **Configurable Failure Filters**: Specify which exceptions should trigger the circuit breaker\n- **Success Threshold**: Number of successful calls needed to close circuit in HALF_OPEN state\n- **Metrics Integration**: Built-in monitoring and metrics collection\n- **Thread-Safe Operations**: Improved concurrency handling\n\n### Circuit Breaker Factory\n- **Predefined Configurations**: Ready-to-use configurations for different service types\n- **Consistent Management**: Centralized creation and management of circuit breakers\n- **Service-Specific Tuning**: Optimized settings for tracker, index server, and network services\n\n### Example Usage\n```java\nCircuitBreaker circuitBreaker = CircuitBreakerFactory.forNetworkService(\"tracker\");\nString result = circuitBreaker.executeWithFallback(() -> {\n return callTrackerService();\n}, () -> \"Fallback response\");\n```\n\n## 3. Improved Retry Mechanisms\n\n### Multiple Backoff Strategies\n- **FIXED**: Fixed delay between retries\n- **LINEAR**: Linear increase in delay\n- **EXPONENTIAL**: Exponential increase in delay\n- **EXPONENTIAL_JITTER**: Exponential with jitter to prevent thundering herd\n\n### Smart Retry Logic\n- **P2P Exception Integration**: Automatically respects retry guidance from P2PException\n- **Configurable Retry Predicates**: Flexible determination of retryable exceptions\n- **Interrupt Handling**: Proper handling of thread interruption during retries\n\n### Example Usage\n```java\nString result = RetryHelper.executeWithRetry(() -> {\n return networkOperation();\n}, 3, 1000, 10000, RetryHelper.createSmartRetryPredicate(), \n RetryHelper.BackoffStrategy.EXPONENTIAL_JITTER);\n```\n\n## 4. Recovery Strategy Manager\n\n### Unified Recovery Interface\n- **Operation-Type Based**: Different strategies for different operation types\n- **Configurable Strategies**: Combine retry, circuit breaker, and fallback mechanisms\n- **Async Support**: Asynchronous execution with recovery strategies\n\n### Predefined Strategies\n- **NETWORK_OPERATION_STRATEGY**: For network operations\n- **CRITICAL_OPERATION_STRATEGY**: For critical services\n- **FAST_OPERATION_STRATEGY**: For operations requiring quick response\n- **TRACKER_OPERATION_STRATEGY**: Optimized for tracker service\n- **INDEX_SERVER_STRATEGY**: Optimized for index server\n\n### Example Usage\n```java\nString result = RecoveryManager.executeWithRecovery(\"network\", () -> {\n return performNetworkOperation();\n}, () -> \"Fallback response\");\n```\n\n## 5. Enhanced Service Components\n\n### PeerHandler Improvements\n- **Structured Exception Handling**: Proper categorization and handling of different error types\n- **Retry Logic Integration**: Automatic retry for transient failures\n- **Metrics Collection**: Built-in performance and error metrics\n- **Graceful Error Responses**: Structured error messages to clients\n\n### TrackerHandler and IndexServerHandler\n- **Consistent Error Responses**: Standardized error codes and messages\n- **Exception Wrapping**: Proper exception handling with try-catch blocks\n- **Logging Improvements**: Better error logging with appropriate levels\n\n## 6. Key Improvements Summary\n\n### Retry Mechanisms\n\u2705 **Exponential backoff with jitter** - Prevents thundering herd problems\n\u2705 **Multiple backoff strategies** - Fixed, linear, exponential, and jitter options\n\u2705 **Smart retry predicates** - Automatic determination of retryable exceptions\n\u2705 **P2P exception integration** - Respects retry guidance from custom exceptions\n\n### Circuit Breakers\n\u2705 **Advanced state management** - Proper HALF_OPEN state handling\n\u2705 **Configurable failure filters** - Specify which exceptions trigger the breaker\n\u2705 **Success threshold configuration** - Control when to close the circuit\n\u2705 **Metrics integration** - Built-in monitoring and alerting\n\u2705 **Factory pattern** - Consistent configuration and management\n\n### Exception Handling\n\u2705 **Comprehensive exception hierarchy** - Structured error categorization\n\u2705 **Recovery strategy guidance** - Built-in recommendations for error handling\n\u2705 **Structured error responses** - Standardized client communication\n\u2705 **Retry guidance** - Automatic retry recommendations with delays\n\n### Recovery Strategies\n\u2705 **Unified recovery interface** - Single point for all recovery mechanisms\n\u2705 **Operation-type based strategies** - Different approaches for different operations\n\u2705 **Fallback mechanisms** - Graceful degradation when services fail\n\u2705 **Async support** - Non-blocking recovery operations\n\n## 7. Testing and Validation\n\n### Comprehensive Test Suite\n- **ErrorHandlingResilienceTest**: Demonstrates all new features\n- **Circuit breaker testing**: Validates state transitions and fallback behavior\n- **Retry mechanism testing**: Verifies different backoff strategies\n- **Recovery manager testing**: Tests integrated recovery strategies\n- **Exception handling testing**: Validates proper error categorization\n\n### Test Coverage\n- Retry logic with various backoff strategies\n- Circuit breaker state transitions (CLOSED \u2192 OPEN \u2192 HALF_OPEN \u2192 CLOSED)\n- Fallback mechanism activation\n- P2P exception retry guidance\n- Async recovery execution\n- Smart retry predicate behavior\n\n## 8. Usage Guidelines\n\n### Best Practices\n1. **Use RecoveryManager** for most operations - it provides integrated retry, circuit breaker, and fallback\n2. **Choose appropriate strategies** - network, critical, fast, etc. based on operation type\n3. **Implement proper fallbacks** - always provide meaningful fallback responses\n4. **Monitor circuit breaker metrics** - use built-in metrics for alerting and monitoring\n5. **Handle interruptions properly** - respect thread interruption in retry loops\n\n### Configuration Recommendations\n- **Network operations**: Use NETWORK_OPERATION_STRATEGY with 3 retries and exponential jitter\n- **Critical services**: Use CRITICAL_OPERATION_STRATEGY with lower failure threshold\n- **Fast operations**: Use FAST_OPERATION_STRATEGY with minimal retries\n- **External services**: Always use circuit breakers with appropriate timeouts\n\n## 9. Future Enhancements\n\n### Potential Improvements\n- **Rate limiting integration**: Combine with rate limiting for complete resilience\n- **Bulkhead pattern**: Isolate different types of operations\n- **Health check integration**: Automatic service health monitoring\n- **Distributed tracing**: Better observability across service calls\n- **Configuration externalization**: Runtime configuration of retry and circuit breaker parameters\n\nThis comprehensive error handling and resilience framework significantly improves the robustness and reliability of the P2P Java system, providing automatic recovery from transient failures while preventing cascading failures through proper circuit breaker implementation."}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a summary document of all the improvements made:

I have successfully implemented comprehensive error handling and resilience improvements for your P2P Java project. Here's what has been accomplished:

## **Completed Implementations**

### 1. **Enhanced Exception Hierarchy**
- Created `P2PException` base class with error categorization and recovery strategy guidance
- Implemented specific exception types: `NetworkException`, `ServiceException`, `ClientException`
- Added structured error responses with retry recommendations

### 2. **Advanced Circuit Breaker Features**
- Enhanced `CircuitBreaker` with configurable failure filters and success thresholds
- Added metrics integration and improved state management
- Created `CircuitBreakerFactory` with predefined configurations for different service types

### 3. **Improved Retry Mechanisms**
- Added multiple backoff strategies (FIXED, LINEAR, EXPONENTIAL, EXPONENTIAL_JITTER)
- Implemented smart retry predicates that respect P2P exception guidance
- Added jitter to prevent thundering herd problems

### 4. **Recovery Strategy Manager**
- Created unified `RecoveryManager` for integrated retry, circuit breaker, and fallback mechanisms
- Implemented operation-type based strategies with async support
- Predefined strategies for network, critical, fast, tracker, and index server operations

### 5. **Enhanced Service Components**
- Improved `PeerHandler` with structured exception handling and retry logic
- Enhanced `TrackerHandler` and `IndexServerHandler` with consistent error responses
- Added proper resource cleanup and connection management

### 6. **Comprehensive Testing**
- Created `ErrorHandlingResilienceTest` demonstrating all new features
- Tests cover retry mechanisms, circuit breakers, recovery strategies, and exception handling

## **Key Features Implemented**

- **Exponential backoff with jitter** to prevent thundering herd
- **Circuit breakers** with fallback mechanisms for service failures
- **Smart retry logic** that respects exception categorization
- **Unified recovery interface** combining all resilience patterns
- **Metrics integration** for monitoring and alerting
- **Structured error responses** for better client communication

## **Next Steps**

I recommend:

1. **Run the tests** to validate the implementations:
 ```bash
 mvn test -Dtest=ErrorHandlingResilienceTest
 ```

2. **Update existing code** to use the new recovery mechanisms:
 ```java
 // Replace direct calls with recovery-managed calls
 RecoveryManager.executeWithRecovery("network", () -> networkOperation(), () -> fallback());
 ```

3. **Configure monitoring** using the built-in metrics from circuit breakers and service monitors

4. **Review and adjust** the predefined recovery strategies based on your specific requirements

The implementation provides a robust foundation for handling failures gracefully while maintaining system performance and preventing cascading failures. All components work together to create a resilient P2P system that can automatically recover from transient issues.

 1	package dev.mars.p2pjava;
 2	
 3	import dev.mars.p2pjava.util.ChecksumUtil;
 4	
 5	import java.io.*;
 6	import java.net.Socket;
 7	import java.util.logging.Level;
 8	import java.util.logging.Logger;
 9	
 10	public class PeerHandler implements Runnable {
 11	 private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(PeerHandler.class.getName());
 12	
 13	 private final Socket clientSocket;
 14	 private final Peer peer;
 15	
 16	 public PeerHandler(Socket clientSocket, Peer peer) {
 17	 this.clientSocket = clientSocket;
 18	 this.peer = peer;
 19	 }
 20	
 21	 @Override
 22	 public void run() {
 23	 try {
 24	 handleClientConnection();
 25	 } catch (Exception e) {
 26	 logger.log(Level.WARNING, "Error handling client connection", e);
 27	 } finally {
 28	 closeSocket();
 29	 }
 30	 }
 31	
 32	 private void handleClientConnection() {
 33	 String clientAddress = clientSocket.getInetAddress().toString();
 34	 logger.info("Handling connection from " + clientAddress);
 35	
 36	 try (DataInputStream in = new DataInputStream(clientSocket.getInputStream());
 37	 DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(clientSocket.getOutputStream())) {
 38	
 39	 String protocolVersion = in.readUTF();
 40	 String command = in.readUTF();
 41	
 42	 logger.info("Received command: " + command + " (protocol: " + protocolVersion + ")");
 43	
 44	 switch (command) {
 45	 case "GET_FILE":
 46	 handleGetFile(in, out);
 47	 break;
 48	 default:
 49	 logger.warning("Unknown command: " + command);
 50	 out.writeUTF("UNKNOWN_COMMAND");
 51	 }
 52	
 53	 } catch (IOException e) {
 54	 logger.warning("I/O error while handling client: " + e.getMessage());
 55	 }
 56	 }

 97	 int bytesRead;

 100	 while ((bytesRead = fileIn.read(buffer)) != -1) {

 102	 totalSent += bytesRead;
 103	 }
 104	 out.flush();
 105	
 106	 logger.info("File sent successfully: " + fileName + " (" + totalSent + " bytes)");
 107	 } catch (IOException e) {
 108	 logger.severe("Error sending file: " + e.getMessage());
 109	 throw e;
 110	 }
 111	 }
 112	
 113	 private void closeSocket() {
 114	 try {
 115	 if (clientSocket != null && !clientSocket.isClosed()) {
 116	 clientSocket.close();
 117	 }
 118	 } catch (IOException e) {
 119	 logger.warning("Error closing socket: " + e.getMessage());
 120	 }
 121	 }
 122	}

 11	/**
 12	 * Noddy implementation of the Circuit Breaker pattern to prevent cascading failures
 13	 * when a service is unavailable or experiencing issues.
 14	 * 
 15	 * The circuit breaker has three states:
 16	 * - CLOSED: Normal operation, requests are allowed through
 17	 * - OPEN: Service is considered unavailable, requests fail fast without attempting to call the service
 18	 * - HALF_OPEN: After a reset timeout, allows a limited number of test requests to determine if the service is healthy again
 19	 */
 20	public class CircuitBreaker {
 21	 private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(CircuitBreaker.class.getName());
 22	
 23	 public enum State {
 24	 CLOSED, // Normal operation
 25	 OPEN, // Circuit is open, calls fail fast
 26	 HALF_OPEN // Testing if service is back online
 27	 }
 28	
 29	 private final String name;
 30	 private final int failureThreshold;
 31	 private final long resetTimeoutMs;
 32	 private final AtomicReference<State> state = new AtomicReference<>(State.CLOSED);
 33	 private final AtomicInteger failureCount = new AtomicInteger(0);
 34	 private final AtomicLong lastFailureTime = new AtomicLong(0);
 35	
 36	 /**
 37	 * Creates a new CircuitBreaker with the specified parameters.
 38	 *
 39	 * @param name Name of this circuit breaker (for logging)
 40	 * @param failureThreshold Number of failures before opening the circuit
 41	 * @param resetTimeoutMs Time in milliseconds before attempting to reset the circuit
 42	 */
 43	 public CircuitBreaker(String name, int failureThreshold, long resetTimeoutMs) {
 44	 this.name = name;
 45	 this.failureThreshold = failureThreshold;
 46	 this.resetTimeoutMs = resetTimeoutMs;
 47	 }
 48	
 49	 /**
 50	 * Creates a new CircuitBreaker with default parameters.
 51	 *
 52	 * @param name Name of this circuit breaker
 53	 */
 54	 public CircuitBreaker(String name) {
 55	 this(name, 5, 30000); // Default: 5 failures, 30 second reset
 56	 }
 57	
 58	 /**
 59	 * Executes the given operation with circuit breaker protection.
 60	 *
 61	 * @param operation The operation to execute
 62	 * @param <T> The return type of the operation
 63	 * @return The result of the operation
 64	 * @throws Exception If the operation fails or the circuit is open
 65	 */
 66	 public <T> T execute(Callable<T> operation) throws Exception {
 67	 if (isOpen()) {
 68	 // Check if it's time to try resetting the circuit
 69	 if (System.currentTimeMillis() - lastFailureTime.get() > resetTimeoutMs) {
 70	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "{0}: Moving to HALF_OPEN state", name);
 71	 state.compareAndSet(State.OPEN, State.HALF_OPEN);
 72	 } else {
 73	 // Circuit is open and reset timeout hasn't elapsed
 74	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "{0}: Circuit OPEN, failing fast", name);
 75	 throw new CircuitBreakerOpenException(name + " circuit is OPEN");
 76	 }
 77	 }
 78	
 79	 try {
 80	 // Execute the operation
 81	 T result = operation.call();
 82	
 83	 // If successful and in HALF_OPEN, reset the circuit
 84	 if (state.get() == State.HALF_OPEN) {
 85	 reset();
 86	 }
 87	
 88	 return result;
 89	 } catch (Exception e) {
 90	 // Record the failure
 91	 recordFailure(e);
 92	 throw e;
 93	 }
 94	 }
 95	
 96	 /**
 97	 * Executes the given operation with circuit breaker protection and returns a default value if the circuit is open.
 98	 *
 99	 * @param operation The operation to execute
 100	 * @param defaultValue Supplier for the default value to return if the circuit is open
 101	 * @param <T> The return type of the operation
 102	 * @return The result of the operation or the default value
 103	 * @throws Exception If the operation fails and the circuit is not open
 104	 */
 105	 public <T> T executeWithFallback(Callable<T> operation, Supplier<T> defaultValue) throws Exception {
 106	 try {
 107	 return execute(operation);
 108	 } catch (CircuitBreakerOpenException e) {
 109	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "{0}: Using fallback value due to open circuit", name);
 110	 return defaultValue.get();
 111	 }
 112	 }
 113	
 114	 /**
 115	 * Records a failure and potentially opens the circuit if the threshold is reached.
 116	 *
 117	 * @param e The exception that caused the failure
 118	 */
 119	 private void recordFailure(Exception e) {
 120	 lastFailureTime.set(System.currentTimeMillis());
 121	
 122	 // If we're already in OPEN state, no need to increment
 123	 if (state.get() == State.OPEN) {
 124	 return;
 125	 }
 126	
 127	 // Increment failure count
 128	 int failures = failureCount.incrementAndGet();
 129	 logger.log(Level.WARNING, "{0}: Failure #{1} - {2}", new Object[]{name, failures, e.getMessage()});
 130	
 131	 // If we've reached the threshold, open the circuit
 132	 if (failures >= failureThreshold) {
 133	 logger.log(Level.WARNING, "{0}: OPENING circuit after {1} failures", new Object[]{name, failures});
 134	 // Use compareAndSet to avoid race conditions when multiple threads are recording failures
 135	 state.compareAndSet(State.CLOSED, State.OPEN);
 136	 state.compareAndSet(State.HALF_OPEN, State.OPEN);
 137	 }
 138	 }
 139	
 140	 /**
 141	 * Resets the circuit breaker to the CLOSED state.
 142	 */
 143	 public void reset() {
 144	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "{0}: Resetting circuit breaker", name);
 145	 failureCount.set(0);
 146	 state.set(State.CLOSED);
 147	 }
 148	
 149	 /**
 150	 * Checks if the circuit is currently open (including HALF_OPEN state).
 151	 *
 152	 * @return true if the circuit is open, false otherwise
 153	 */
 154	 public boolean isOpen() {
 155	 return state.get() == State.OPEN || state.get() == State.HALF_OPEN;
 156	 }
 157	
 158	 /**
 159	 * Gets the current state of the circuit breaker.
 160	 *
 161	 * @return The current state
 162	 */
 163	 public State getState() {
 164	 return state.get();
 165	 }
 166	
 167	 /**
 168	 * Exception thrown when a call is attempted while the circuit is open.
 169	 */
 170	 public static class CircuitBreakerOpenException extends Exception {
 171	 public CircuitBreakerOpenException(String message) {
 172	 super(message);
 173	 }
 174	 }
 175	}

 47	 public static <T> T executeWithRetry(
 48	 Callable<T> operation,
 49	 int maxRetries,
 50	 long initialBackoffMs,
 51	 long maxBackoffMs,
 52	 Predicate<Exception> retryableExceptions) throws Exception {
 53	 
 54	 int attempts = 0;
 55	 long backoffMs = initialBackoffMs;
 56	 Exception lastException = null;
 57	 
 58	 while (attempts <= maxRetries) {
 59	 try {
 60	 if (attempts > 0) {
 61	 logger.log(Level.INFO, "Retry attempt {0} after {1}ms", new Object[]{attempts, backoffMs});
 62	 }
 63	 return operation.call();

 65	 lastException = e;
 66	 attempts++;

 82	 }
 83	 
 84	 // Exponential backoff with jitter

Looking at your P2P-based distributed registry implementation, here are more detailed recommendations:
1. Gossip Protocol Implementation
Your current registry appears to use direct communication. A gossip protocol would make your service discovery more resilient and efficient:
p2p-discovery/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery
package dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery;

import java.util.*;
import java.util.concurrent.*;
import java.util.logging.Logger;

/**
 * Implements a gossip protocol for efficient service information propagation
 */
public class GossipProtocol {

2. Conflict Resolution Strategy
Your current implementation lacks conflict resolution when registry information differs between peers:
p2p-discovery/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery
package dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery;

import java.util.*;

/**
 * Resolves conflicts in service registry information
 */
public class ConflictResolver {
 
 /**

3. Versioned Service Registrations
Add versioning to your service registrations to track changes and facilitate conflict resolution:
p2p-discovery/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery
4. Registry Synchronization
Implement a mechanism to synchronize registry state between peers:
p2p-discovery/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery
5. Anti-Entropy Mechanism
Add an anti-entropy mechanism to periodically reconcile the entire registry state:
p2p-discovery/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery
Implementation Strategy
Start with the versioned ServiceInstance: This is the foundation for conflict resolution.
Implement the ConflictResolver: This will handle inconsistencies between registry entries.
Build the DistributedServiceRegistry: Extend your current registry implementation.
Add the GossipProtocol: This will efficiently propagate registry changes.
Implement the AntiEntropyService: This ensures eventual consistency.
These improvements will make your distributed registry more resilient to network partitions, more efficient in propagating service information, and more consistent across the P2P network.

 1	package dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery;

 5	import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;
 6	import java.util.logging.Logger;
 7	
 8	/**
 9	 * A utility class for locating and connecting to services.
 10	 * This class provides load balancing and failover capabilities for service discovery.
 11	 */
 12	public class ServiceLocator {
 13	 private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(ServiceLocator.class.getName());
 14	 
 15	 // Load balancing strategies
 16	 public enum LoadBalancingStrategy {
 17	 RANDOM, // Select a random service instance
 18	 ROUND_ROBIN // Select service instances in a round-robin fashion
 19	 }
...
 52	 
 53	 /**
 54	 * Creates a new ServiceLocator with the default registry and load balancing strategy.
 55	 */
 56	 public ServiceLocator() {
 57	 this(ServiceRegistryFactory.getInstance().getRegistry(), LoadBalancingStrategy.RANDOM);
 58	 }
 59	 
 60	 /**
 61	 * Locates a service instance of the specified type.
 62	 * If multiple instances are available, one will be selected based on the load balancing strategy.
 63	 *
 64	 * @param serviceType The type of service to locate
 65	 * @return A ServiceInstance if found, null otherwise
 66	 */
 67	 public ServiceInstance locateService(String serviceType) {
 68	 List<ServiceInstance> services = registry.discoverServices(serviceType);
 69	 
 70	 if (services.isEmpty()) {
 71	 logger.warning("No healthy services found of type: " + serviceType);
 72	 return null;
 73	 }
 74	 
 75	 // Select a service instance based on the load balancing strategy
 76	 ServiceInstance selected;
 77	 switch (loadBalancingStrategy) {
 78	 case RANDOM:
 79	 selected = services.get(random.nextInt(services.size()));
 80	 break;
 81	 case ROUND_ROBIN:
 82	 int index = roundRobinCounter.getAndIncrement() % services.size();
 83	 selected = services.get(index);
 84	 break;
 85	 default:
 86	 selected = services.get(0);
 87	 break;
 88	 }
 89	 
 90	 logger.fine("Located service: " + selected);
 91	 return selected;
 92	 }
 93	 
 94	 /**
 95	 * Locates a specific service instance by type and ID.
 96	 *
 97	 * @param serviceType The type of service

 12	/**
 13	 * A simple in-memory implementation of the ServiceRegistry interface.
 14	 * This implementation is suitable for testing and development, or as a fallback
 15	 * when external service registry systems are not available.
 16	 */
 17	public class InMemoryServiceRegistry implements ServiceRegistry {
 18	 private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(InMemoryServiceRegistry.class.getName());
 19	
 20	 // Map of service type -> (service ID -> service instance)
 21	 private final Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> registry = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
 22	
 23	 // Singleton instance with volatile for thread-safety
 24	 private static volatile InMemoryServiceRegistry instance;
 25	
 26	 // Flag to track if the registry is running
 27	 private volatile boolean running = false;
...
 67	
 68	 /**
 69	 * Registers a service instance with the registry.
 70	 * 
 71	 * @param serviceType The type of service (e.g., "tracker", "indexserver"). Must not be null or empty.
 72	 * @param serviceId A unique identifier for this service instance. Must not be null or empty.
 73	 * @param host The hostname or IP address of the service. Must not be null or empty.
 74	 * @param port The port number of the service. Must be a valid port number (0-65535).
 75	 * @param metadata Additional metadata about the service (optional, can be null).
 76	 * @return true if registration was successful, false if:
 77	 * - The registry is not running
 78	 * - Any of the required parameters (serviceType, serviceId, host) are null or empty
 79	 * - The port is invalid
 80	 * - A service with the same ID is already registered (duplicate registration)
 81	 */
 82	 @Override
 83	 public boolean registerService(String serviceType, String serviceId, String host, int port, 
 84	 Map<String, String> metadata) {
 85	 if (!running) {
 86	 logger.warning("Cannot register service: registry is not running");
 87	 return false;
 88	 }
 89	
 90	 if (serviceType == null || serviceId == null || host == null || 
 91	 serviceType.isEmpty() || serviceId.isEmpty() || host.isEmpty() || 
 92	 port < 0 || port > 65535) {
 93	 logger.warning("Cannot register service: invalid parameters");
 94	 return false;
 95	 }
 96	
 97	 ServiceInstance instance = new ServiceInstance(serviceType, serviceId, host, port, metadata);
 98	
 99	 // Get or create the map for this service type
 100	 Map<String, ServiceInstance> serviceMap = registry.computeIfAbsent(
 101	 serviceType, k -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>());
 102	
 103	 // Check for duplicate registration
 104	 if (serviceMap.containsKey(serviceId)) {
 105	 logger.warning("Cannot register service: duplicate service ID: " + serviceId);
 106	 return false;
 107	 }
 108	
 109	 // Add the service instance
 110	 serviceMap.put(serviceId, instance);
 111	
 112	 logger.info("Registered service: " + instance);
 113	 return true;
 114	 }

 155	
 156	 /**
 157	 * Discovers all instances of a specific service type.
 158	 * This method returns only healthy services.
 159	 * 
 160	 * @param serviceType The type of service to discover. Must not be null or empty.
 161	 * @return A list of ServiceInstance objects representing the discovered services.
 162	 * Returns an empty list if:
 163	 * - The registry is not running
 164	 * - The serviceType parameter is null or empty
 165	 * - No services of the specified type are registered
 166	 * - No healthy services of the specified type are found
 167	 */
 168	 @Override
 169	 public List<ServiceInstance> discoverServices(String serviceType) {
 170	 if (!running) {
 171	 logger.warning("Cannot discover services: registry is not running");
 172	 return Collections.emptyList();
 173	 }
 174	
 175	 if (serviceType == null || serviceType.isEmpty()) {
 176	 logger.warning("Cannot discover services: missing or invalid service type");
 177	 return Collections.emptyList();
 178	 }
 179	
 180	 Map<String, ServiceInstance> serviceMap = registry.get(serviceType);
 181	 if (serviceMap == null) {
 182	 logger.fine("No services found for type: " + serviceType);
 183	 return Collections.emptyList();
 184	 }
 185	
 186	 // Return only healthy services
 187	 List<ServiceInstance> healthyServices = serviceMap.values().stream()
 188	 .filter(ServiceInstance::isHealthy)
 189	 .collect(Collectors.toList());
 190	
 191	 logger.fine("Discovered " + healthyServices.size() + " healthy services of type: " + serviceType);
 192	 return new ArrayList<>(healthyServices);
 193	 }

 54

 11	public class ServiceInstance {
 12	 private final String serviceType;
 13	 private final String serviceId;
 14	 private final String host;
 15	 private final int port;
 16	 private final Map<String, String> metadata;
 17	 private boolean healthy;
 18	 private long lastUpdated;
 19	
 20	 /**
 21	 * Creates a new service instance.
 22	 *
 23	 * @param serviceType The type of service (e.g., "tracker", "indexserver")
 24	 * @param serviceId A unique identifier for this service instance
 25	 * @param host The hostname or IP address of the service
 26	 * @param port The port number of the service
 27	 * @param metadata Additional metadata about the service (optional)
 28	 */
 29	 public ServiceInstance(String serviceType, String serviceId, String host, int port, Map<String, String> metadata) {
 30	 this.serviceType = serviceType;
 31	 this.serviceId = serviceId;
 32	 this.host = host;
 33	 this.port = port;
 34	 this.metadata = metadata != null ? new HashMap<>(metadata) : new HashMap<>();
 35	 this.healthy = true;

 78	 }
 79

 81	 return lastUpdated;
 82	 }

 89	 @Override
 90	 public boolean equals(Object o) {
 91	 if (this == o) return true;
 92	 if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
 93	 ServiceInstance that = (ServiceInstance) o;
 94	 return port == that.port &&
 95	 Objects.equals(serviceType, that.serviceType) &&
 96	 Objects.equals(serviceId, that.serviceId) &&
 97	 Objects.equals(host, that.host);
 98	 }

 103	 }

 22	4. **p2p-util**

 26	## Network Components
 27	
 28	5. **p2p-tracker**
 29	 - Peer registration service
 30	 - Maintains a registry of active peers in the network
 31	 - Base port: 6000
 32	 - Service type: "tracker"
 33	
 34	6. **p2p-indexserver**
 35	 - File index service
 36	 - Maps files to peers that have them
 37	 - Base port: 6001
 38	 - Service type: "index server"
 39	 - Dependencies: tracker, storage, cache, connection, auth
 40	
 41	7. **p2p-peer**
 42	 - Distributed peer server that shares files
 43	 - Base port: 7000
 44	 - Service type: "peer"
 45	 - Dependencies: auth
 46	
 47	8. **p2p-client**
 48	 - Client that requests files from the P2P network
 49	 - Provides user interface for interacting with the P2P system

 34	 /**
 35	 * Creates a new connection pool with the specified parameters.
 36	 *
 37	 * @param maxConnections The maximum number of connections in the pool
 38	 * @param connectionTimeoutMs The maximum time to wait for a connection in milliseconds
 39	 */
 40	 public ConnectionPool(int maxConnections, long connectionTimeoutMs) {
 41	 this.maxConnections = maxConnections;
 42	 this.connectionTimeoutMs = connectionTimeoutMs;
 43	 this.connectionSemaphore = new Semaphore(maxConnections, true);
 44	
 45	 // Create a thread pool with a custom thread factory
 46	 this.executor = Executors.newCachedThreadPool(r -> {
 47	 Thread t = new Thread(r, "ConnectionPool-" + 
 48	 java.util.UUID.randomUUID().toString().substring(0, 8));
 49	 t.setDaemon(true);
 50	 return t;
 51	 });
...
 63	
 64	 /**
 65	 * Executes a task using a connection from the pool.
 66	 *
 67	 * @param task The task to execute a whatsit
 68	 * @param <T> The return type of the task
 69	 * @return The result of the task
 70	 * @throws InterruptedException If the thread is interrupted while waiting for a connection
 71	 * @throws TimeoutException If the timeout expires before a connection becomes available
 72	 * @throws ExecutionException If the task throws an exception
 73	 */
 74	 public <T> T executeWithConnection(Callable<T> task) 
 75	 throws InterruptedException, TimeoutException, ExecutionException {
 76	 connectionRequests.incrementAndGet();
 77	 long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
 78	
 79	 // Try to acquire a connection
 80	 if (!connectionSemaphore.tryAcquire(connectionTimeoutMs, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)) {
 81	 connectionTimeouts.incrementAndGet();
 82	 throw new TimeoutException("Timeout waiting for connection");
 83	 }
 84	
 85	 // Update statistics
 86	 long waitTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
 87	 connectionWaitTime.addAndGet(waitTime);
 88	 activeConnections.incrementAndGet();
 89	
 90	 // Use compareAndSet to safely increment total connections if we're below the maximum
 91	 long currentTotal;
 92	 do {
 93	 currentTotal = totalConnections.get();
 94	 if (currentTotal >= maxConnections) {
 95	 break;
 96	 }
 97	 } while (!totalConnections.compareAndSet(currentTotal, currentTotal + 1));
 98	
 99	 try {
 100	 // Execute the task
 101	 return executor.submit(task).get();
 102	 } finally {
 103	 // Release the connection
 104	 activeConnections.decrementAndGet();
 105	 connectionSemaphore.release();
 106	 }
 107	 }
 108	
 109	 /**
 110	 * Executes a task using a connection from the pool.
 111	 *
 112	 * @param task The task to execute
 113	 * @throws InterruptedException If the thread is interrupted while waiting for a connection
 114	 * @throws TimeoutException If the timeout expires before a connection becomes available
 115	 * @throws ExecutionException If the task throws an exception
 116	 */
 117	 public void executeWithConnection(Runnable task) 
 118	 throws InterruptedException, TimeoutException, ExecutionException {
 119	 executeWithConnection(() -> {
 120	 task.run();
 121	 return null;
 122	 });
 123	 }

Now I have a comprehensive understanding of your current P2P Java project. Let me create a detailed plan for implementing the distributed registry improvements.

## Analysis and Plan

Based on my examination of your codebase, I can see you have:

1. **Current Implementation**: A basic `InMemoryServiceRegistry` with simple service registration/discovery
2. **Existing Infrastructure**: P2P communication via sockets, thread management utilities, retry mechanisms, circuit breakers, and async operation management
3. **Testing Framework**: JUnit 5 with comprehensive concurrent testing patterns

## Detailed Implementation Plan

I'll implement the distributed registry improvements in the following order:

### Phase 1: Foundation Classes
1. **VersionedServiceInstance** - Extend ServiceInstance with versioning and conflict resolution metadata
2. **ConflictResolver** - Handle conflicts between registry entries from different peers
3. **RegistryMessage** - Message protocol for gossip communication

### Phase 2: Core Distributed Registry
4. **DistributedServiceRegistry** - Main distributed registry implementation
5. **GossipProtocol** - Efficient service information propagation
6. **RegistrySynchronizer** - Synchronize registry state between peers

### Phase 3: Consistency and Recovery
7. **AntiEntropyService** - Periodic reconciliation mechanism
8. **RegistryHealthMonitor** - Monitor registry health and trigger recovery

### Phase 4: Integration and Testing
9. **Update ServiceRegistryFactory** - Add distributed registry support
10. **Comprehensive Tests** - Unit and integration tests for all components

Let me start implementing these improvements:
