 246	 @Test
 247	 void testConcurrentAccess() throws InterruptedException {
 248	 // Test concurrent registration and deregistration with increased contention
 249	 final int THREAD_COUNT = 50; // Increased thread count for more contention
 250	 final int OPERATIONS_PER_THREAD = 100;
 251	 final int SHARED_SERVICES = 20; // Number of service IDs that will be shared among threads
 252	 final ExecutorService executor = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(THREAD_COUNT);
 253	 final CountDownLatch startLatch = new CountDownLatch(1); // Used to start all threads at once
 254	 final CountDownLatch completionLatch = new CountDownLatch(THREAD_COUNT);
 255	 final AtomicInteger successfulRegistrations = new AtomicInteger(0);
 256	 final AtomicInteger successfulDeregistrations = new AtomicInteger(0);
 257	 final AtomicInteger failedRegistrations = new AtomicInteger(0);
 258	 final AtomicInteger failedDeregistrations = new AtomicInteger(0);
 259	
 260	 // Create a barrier to synchronize threads at specific points to increase contention
 261	 final CyclicBarrier barrier = new CyclicBarrier(10, () -> {
 262	 // This will run each time 10 threads reach the barrier
 263	 // Sleep briefly to ensure threads are competing for resources
 264	 try {
 265	 Thread.sleep(5);
 266	 } catch (InterruptedException e) {
 267	 Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
 268	 }
 269	 });
 270	
 271	 // Create and submit tasks
 272	 for (int i = 0; i < THREAD_COUNT; i++) {
 273	 final int threadId = i;
 274	 executor.submit(() -> {
 275	 try {
 276	 // Wait for the signal to start
 277	 startLatch.await();
 278	
 279	 for (int j = 0; j < OPERATIONS_PER_THREAD; j++) {
 280	 // Use a mix of unique and shared service IDs to create contention
 281	 String serviceId;
 282	 if (j % 5 == 0) { // 20% of operations use shared IDs
 283	 // Use a shared service ID to create contention
 284	 serviceId = "shared-service-" + (j % SHARED_SERVICES);
 285	
 286	 // Synchronize some threads to increase likelihood of contention
 287	 if (threadId % 5 == 0) {
 288	 try {
 289	 barrier.await(100, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
 290	 } catch (Exception e) {
 291	 // Ignore timeout exceptions
 292	 }
 293	 }
 294	 } else {
 295	 // Use a unique service ID
 296	 serviceId = "service-" + threadId + "-" + j;
 297	 }
 298	
 299	 // Register a service
 300	 boolean registered = registry.registerService(
 301	 TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, serviceId, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT + (j % 1000), null);
 302	 if (registered) {
 303	 successfulRegistrations.incrementAndGet();
 304	 } else {
 305	 failedRegistrations.incrementAndGet();
 306	 }
 307	
 308	 // Add a small random delay to increase chance of race conditions
 309	 if (j % 10 == 0) {
 310	 Thread.sleep(ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt(1, 5));
 311	 }
 312	
 313	 // Perform some service discovery operations to test concurrent reads
 314	 if (j % 7 == 0) {
 315	 registry.findServiceInstances(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE);
 316	 }
 317	
 318	 if (j % 11 == 0) {
 319	 registry.findServiceInstanceById(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, serviceId);
 320	 }
 321	
 322	 // Deregister the service
 323	 boolean deregistered = registry.deregisterService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, serviceId);
 324	 if (deregistered) {
 325	 successfulDeregistrations.incrementAndGet();
 326	 } else {
 327	 failedDeregistrations.incrementAndGet();
 328	 }
 329	 }
 330	 } catch (Exception e) {
 331	 System.err.println("Thread " + threadId + " encountered exception: " + e.getMessage());
 332	 e.printStackTrace();
 333	 } finally {
 334	 completionLatch.countDown();
 335	 }
 336	 });
 337	 }
 338	
 339	 // Start all threads at once
 340	 startLatch.countDown();
 341	
 342	 // Wait for all threads to complete with a longer timeout
 343	 assertTrue(completionLatch.await(120, TimeUnit.SECONDS), 
 344	 "All threads should complete within timeout");
 345	 executor.shutdown();
 346	
 347	 // Verify no services remain registered
 348	 List<ServiceInstance> remainingServices = registry.findServiceInstances(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE);
 349	 assertTrue(remainingServices.isEmpty(), "No services should remain registered after test");
 350	
 351	 System.out.println("Concurrent test results - Successful registrations: " + 
 352	 successfulRegistrations.get() + ", Successful deregistrations: " + 
 353	 successfulDeregistrations.get() + ", Failed registrations: " + 
 354	 failedRegistrations.get() + ", Failed deregistrations: " + 
 355	 failedDeregistrations.get());
 356	
 357	 // We don't assert that registrations == deregistrations because with shared service IDs,
 358	 // some registrations will fail due to duplicate IDs, which is expected behavior
 359	 }

 378	 @Test
 379	 void testThreadSafeSingletonCreation() throws InterruptedException {
 380	 // Reset the singleton instance to ensure we're testing the creation process
 381	 InMemoryServiceRegistry.reset();
 382	
 383	 // Number of threads that will try to get the instance simultaneously
 384	 final int THREAD_COUNT = 50;
 385	 final ExecutorService executor = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(THREAD_COUNT);
 386	 final CountDownLatch startLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
 387	 final CountDownLatch completionLatch = new CountDownLatch(THREAD_COUNT);
 388	
 389	 // Array to hold instances obtained by each thread
 390	 final InMemoryServiceRegistry[] instances = new InMemoryServiceRegistry[THREAD_COUNT];
 391	
 392	 // Create and submit tasks
 393	 for (int i = 0; i < THREAD_COUNT; i++) {
 394	 final int threadId = i;
 395	 executor.submit(() -> {
 396	 try {
 397	 // Wait for the signal to start
 398	 startLatch.await();
 399	
 400	 // Get the instance
 401	 instances[threadId] = InMemoryServiceRegistry.getInstance();
 402	 } catch (Exception e) {
 403	 System.err.println("Thread " + threadId + " encountered exception: " + e.getMessage());
 404	 e.printStackTrace();
 405	 } finally {
 406	 completionLatch.countDown();
 407	 }
 408	 });
 409	 }
 410	
 411	 // Start all threads at once
 412	 startLatch.countDown();
 413	
 414	 // Wait for all threads to complete
 415	 assertTrue(completionLatch.await(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS), 
 416	 "All threads should complete within timeout");
 417	 executor.shutdown();
 418	
 419	 // Verify that all threads got the same instance
 420	 InMemoryServiceRegistry firstInstance = instances[0];
 421	 assertNotNull(firstInstance, "First instance should not be null");
 422	
 423	 for (int i = 1; i < THREAD_COUNT; i++) {
 424	 assertSame(firstInstance, instances[i], 
 425	 "Thread " + i + " should get the same instance as thread 0");
 426	 }
 427	 }
 428	}

Now I have a comprehensive understanding of your current P2P Java project. Let me create a detailed plan for implementing the distributed registry improvements.

## Analysis and Plan

Based on my examination of your codebase, I can see you have:

1. **Current Implementation**: A basic `InMemoryServiceRegistry` with simple service registration/discovery
2. **Existing Infrastructure**: P2P communication via sockets, thread management utilities, retry mechanisms, circuit breakers, and async operation management
3. **Testing Framework**: JUnit 5 with comprehensive concurrent testing patterns

## Detailed Implementation Plan

I'll implement the distributed registry improvements in the following order:

### Phase 1: Foundation Classes
1. **VersionedServiceInstance** - Extend ServiceInstance with versioning and conflict resolution metadata
2. **ConflictResolver** - Handle conflicts between registry entries from different peers
3. **RegistryMessage** - Message protocol for gossip communication

### Phase 2: Core Distributed Registry
4. **DistributedServiceRegistry** - Main distributed registry implementation
5. **GossipProtocol** - Efficient service information propagation
6. **RegistrySynchronizer** - Synchronize registry state between peers

### Phase 3: Consistency and Recovery
7. **AntiEntropyService** - Periodic reconciliation mechanism
8. **RegistryHealthMonitor** - Monitor registry health and trigger recovery

### Phase 4: Integration and Testing
9. **Update ServiceRegistryFactory** - Add distributed registry support
10. **Comprehensive Tests** - Unit and integration tests for all components

Let me start implementing these improvements:

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "p2p-discovery/src/main/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery/ConflictResolver.java", "file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery;\n\nimport java.util.*;\nimport java.util.logging.Logger;\n\n/**\n * Resolves conflicts in service registry information between different peers.\n * Uses various strategies to determine which service instance should take precedence\n * when conflicts arise in a distributed environment.\n */\npublic class ConflictResolver {\n private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(ConflictResolver.class.getName());\n \n /**\n * Conflict resolution strategies\n */\n public enum ResolutionStrategy {\n LAST_WRITE_WINS, // Use the service instance with the highest version\n ORIGIN_PRIORITY, // Prefer instances from specific origin peers\n HEALTH_PRIORITY, // Prefer healthy instances over unhealthy ones\n COMPOSITE // Use multiple strategies in combination\n }\n \n private final ResolutionStrategy strategy;\n private final Set<String> priorityPeers;\n \n /**\n * Creates a conflict resolver with the specified strategy.\n */\n public ConflictResolver(ResolutionStrategy strategy) {\n this.strategy = strategy;\n this.priorityPeers = new HashSet<>();\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a conflict resolver with priority peers for ORIGIN_PRIORITY strategy.\n */\n public ConflictResolver(ResolutionStrategy strategy, Set<String> priorityPeers) {\n this.strategy = strategy;\n this.priorityPeers = new HashSet<>(priorityPeers);\n }\n \n /**\n * Resolves conflicts between multiple service instances with the same service ID.\n * \n * @param conflictingInstances List of conflicting service instances\n * @return The resolved service instance that should be used\n */\n public ServiceInstance resolveConflict(List<ServiceInstance> conflictingInstances) {\n if (conflictingInstances == null || conflictingInstances.isEmpty()) {\n return null;\n }\n \n if (conflictingInstances.size() == 1) {\n return conflictingInstances.get(0);\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Resolving conflict between \" + conflictingInstances.size() + \n \" service instances using strategy: \" + strategy);\n \n switch (strategy) {\n case LAST_WRITE_WINS:\n return resolveByLastWrite(conflictingInstances);\n case ORIGIN_PRIORITY:\n return resolveByOriginPriority(conflictingInstances);\n case HEALTH_PRIORITY:\n return resolveByHealthPriority(conflictingInstances);\n case COMPOSITE:\n return resolveByComposite(conflictingInstances);\n default:\n logger.warning(\"Unknown resolution strategy: \" + strategy + \", falling back to LAST_WRITE_WINS\");\n return resolveByLastWrite(conflictingInstances);\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Resolves conflict by selecting the instance with the highest version (last write wins).\n */\n private ServiceInstance resolveByLastWrite(List<ServiceInstance> instances) {\n return instances.stream()\n .max(Comparator.comparingLong(ServiceInstance::getVersion))\n .orElse(instances.get(0));\n }\n \n /**\n * Resolves conflict by preferring instances from priority peers.\n */\n private ServiceInstance resolveByOriginPriority(List<ServiceInstance> instances) {\n // First, try to find an instance from a priority peer\n Optional<ServiceInstance> priorityInstance = instances.stream()\n .filter(instance -> priorityPeers.contains(instance.getOriginPeerId()))\n .max(Comparator.comparingLong(ServiceInstance::getVersion));\n \n if (priorityInstance.isPresent()) {\n logger.fine(\"Resolved conflict using priority peer: \" + priorityInstance.get().getOriginPeerId());\n return priorityInstance.get();\n }\n \n // If no priority peer instance found, fall back to last write wins\n logger.fine(\"No priority peer instance found, falling back to last write wins\");\n return resolveByLastWrite(instances);\n }\n \n /**\n * Resolves conflict by preferring healthy instances over unhealthy ones.\n */\n private ServiceInstance resolveByHealthPriority(List<ServiceInstance> instances) {\n // Separate healthy and unhealthy instances\n List<ServiceInstance> healthyInstances = instances.stream()\n .filter(ServiceInstance::isHealthy)\n .collect(ArrayList::new, ArrayList::add, ArrayList::addAll);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> unhealthyInstances = instances.stream()\n .filter(instance -> !instance.isHealthy())\n .collect(ArrayList::new, ArrayList::add, ArrayList::addAll);\n \n // Prefer healthy instances\n if (!healthyInstances.isEmpty()) {\n logger.fine(\"Resolved conflict using healthy instance\");\n return resolveByLastWrite(healthyInstances);\n }\n \n // If no healthy instances, use unhealthy ones\n logger.fine(\"No healthy instances found, using unhealthy instance\");\n return resolveByLastWrite(unhealthyInstances);\n }\n \n /**\n * Resolves conflict using a composite strategy that combines multiple approaches.\n */\n private ServiceInstance resolveByComposite(List<ServiceInstance> instances) {\n // Step 1: Filter by health (prefer healthy instances)\n List<ServiceInstance> healthyInstances = instances.stream()\n .filter(ServiceInstance::isHealthy)\n .collect(ArrayList::new, ArrayList::add, ArrayList::addAll);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> candidateInstances = healthyInstances.isEmpty() ? instances : healthyInstances;\n \n // Step 2: Apply origin priority if available\n if (!priorityPeers.isEmpty()) {\n Optional<ServiceInstance> priorityInstance = candidateInstances.stream()\n .filter(instance -> priorityPeers.contains(instance.getOriginPeerId()))\n .max(Comparator.comparingLong(ServiceInstance::getVersion));\n \n if (priorityInstance.isPresent()) {\n logger.fine(\"Composite resolution: selected priority peer instance\");\n return priorityInstance.get();\n }\n }\n \n // Step 3: Fall back to last write wins\n logger.fine(\"Composite resolution: falling back to last write wins\");\n return resolveByLastWrite(candidateInstances);\n }\n \n /**\n * Merges metadata from conflicting instances, preferring newer values.\n */\n public Map<String, String> mergeMetadata(List<ServiceInstance> instances) {\n Map<String, String> mergedMetadata = new HashMap<>();\n \n // Sort instances by version (oldest first)\n instances.stream()\n .sorted(Comparator.comparingLong(ServiceInstance::getVersion))\n .forEach(instance -> {\n // Newer metadata overwrites older metadata\n mergedMetadata.putAll(instance.getMetadata());\n });\n \n return mergedMetadata;\n }\n \n /**\n * Determines if two service instances are in conflict (same service ID but different details).\n */\n public boolean isConflict(ServiceInstance instance1, ServiceInstance instance2) {\n if (instance1 == null || instance2 == null) {\n return false;\n }\n \n // Same service ID but different versions, hosts, ports, or health status\n return instance1.getServiceId().equals(instance2.getServiceId()) &&\n instance1.getServiceType().equals(instance2.getServiceType()) &&\n (instance1.getVersion() != instance2.getVersion() ||\n !instance1.getHost().equals(instance2.getHost()) ||\n instance1.getPort() != instance2.getPort() ||\n instance1.isHealthy() != instance2.isHealthy());\n }\n \n /**\n * Adds a priority peer for ORIGIN_PRIORITY and COMPOSITE strategies.\n */\n public void addPriorityPeer(String peerId) {\n priorityPeers.add(peerId);\n }\n \n /**\n * Removes a priority peer.\n */\n public void removePriorityPeer(String peerId) {\n priorityPeers.remove(peerId);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets the current set of priority peers.\n */\n public Set<String> getPriorityPeers() {\n return new HashSet<>(priorityPeers);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets the current resolution strategy.\n */\n public ResolutionStrategy getStrategy() {\n return strategy;\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create the ConflictResolver class:

{\n private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;\n \n /**\n * Types of registry messages\n */\n public enum MessageType {\n SERVICE_REGISTER, // Register a new service\n SERVICE_DEREGISTER, // Deregister an existing service\n SERVICE_UPDATE, // Update service information\n SYNC_REQUEST, // Request full registry synchronization\n SYNC_RESPONSE, // Response to sync request with registry data\n HEARTBEAT, // Periodic heartbeat with service status\n ANTI_ENTROPY // Anti-entropy reconciliation message\n }\n \n private final MessageType type;\n private final String senderId;\n private final long timestamp;\n private final String messageId;\n \n // Service-specific fields\n private ServiceInstance serviceInstance;\n private String serviceType;\n private String serviceId;\n \n // Synchronization fields\n private Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> registrySnapshot;\n private Set<String> requestedServiceTypes;\n private long syncVersion;\n \n // Gossip protocol fields\n senderId, ServiceInstance serviceInstance) {\n RegistryMessage message = new RegistryMessage(MessageType.SERVICE_REGISTER, senderId);\n message.serviceInstance = serviceInstance;\n message.serviceType = serviceInstance.getServiceType();\n message.serviceId = serviceInstance.getServiceId();\n return message;\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a service deregistration message.\n */\n public static RegistryMessage createServiceDeregister(String senderId, String serviceType, String serviceId) {\n RegistryMessage message = new RegistryMessage(MessageType.SERVICE_DEREGISTER, senderId);\n message.serviceType = serviceType;\n message.serviceId = serviceId;\n return message;\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a service update message.\n */\n public static RegistryMessage createServiceUpdate(String senderId, ServiceInstance serviceInstance) {\n RegistryMessage message = new RegistryMessage(MessageType.SERVICE_UPDATE, senderId);\n message.serviceInstance = serviceInstance;\n message.serviceType = serviceInstance.getServiceType();\n message.serviceId = serviceInstance.getServiceId();\n return message;\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a synchronization request message.\n */\n public static RegistryMessage createSyncRequest(String senderId, Set<String> requestedServiceTypes) {\n RegistryMessage message = new RegistryMessage(MessageType.SYNC_REQUEST, senderId);\n message.requestedServiceTypes = new HashSet<>(requestedServiceTypes);\n return message;\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a synchronization response message.\n */\n public static RegistryMessage createSyncResponse(String senderId, \n Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> registrySnapshot,\n long syncVersion) {\n RegistryMessage message = new RegistryMessage(MessageType.SYNC_RESPONSE, senderId);\n message.registrySnapshot = new HashMap<>(registrySnapshot);\n message.syncVersion = syncVersion;\n return message;\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a heartbeat message.\n */\n public static RegistryMessage createHeartbeat(String senderId, ServiceInstance serviceInstance) {\n RegistryMessage message = new RegistryMessage(MessageType.HEARTBEAT, senderId);\n message.serviceInstance = serviceInstance;\n message.serviceType = serviceInstance.getServiceType();\n message.serviceId = serviceInstance.getServiceId();\n return message;\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates an anti-entropy message.\n */\n public static RegistryMessage createAntiEntropy(String senderId, \n Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> registrySnapshot) {\n RegistryMessage message = new RegistryMessage(MessageType.ANTI_ENTROPY, senderId);\n message.registrySnapshot = new HashMap<>(registrySnapshot);\n return message;\n }\n \n /**\n * Private constructor for creating messages.\n */\n private RegistryMessage(MessageType type, String senderId) {\n this.type = type;\n this.senderId = senderId;\n this.timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis();\n this.messageId = UUID.randomUUID().toString();\n this.hopCount = 0;\n this.visitedPeers = new HashSet<>();\n this.maxHops = 5; // Default maximum hops for gossip propagation\n }\n \n // Getters\n public MessageType getType() {\n return type;\n }\n \n public String getSenderId() {\n return senderId;\n }\n \n public long getTimestamp() {\n return timestamp;\n }\n \n public String getMessageId() {\n return messageId;\n }\n \n public ServiceInstance getServiceInstance() {\n return serviceInstance;\n }\n \n public String getServiceType() {\n return serviceType;\n }\n \n public String getServiceId() {\n return serviceId;\n }\n \n public Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> getRegistrySnapshot() {\n return registrySnapshot != null ? new HashMap<>(registrySnapshot) : null;\n }\n \n public Set<String> getRequestedServiceTypes() {\n return requestedServiceTypes != null ? new HashSet<>(requestedServiceTypes) : null;\n }\n \n public long getSyncVersion() {\n return syncVersion;\n }\n \n public int getHopCount() {\n return hopCount;\n }\n \n public Set<String> getVisitedPeers() {\n return new HashSet<>(visitedPeers);\n }\n \n public int getMaxHops() {\n return maxHops;\n }\n \n // Gossip protocol methods\n public boolean canPropagate() {\n return hopCount < maxHops;\n }\n \n public boolean hasVisited(String peerId) {\n return visitedPeers.contains(peerId);\n }\n \n public RegistryMessage incrementHop(String peerId) {\n RegistryMessage copy = this.copy();\n copy.hopCount++;\n copy.visitedPeers.add(peerId);\n return copy;\n }\n \n public void setMaxHops(int maxHops) {\n this.maxHops = Math.max(1, maxHops);\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a copy of this message for propagation.\n */\n private RegistryMessage copy() {\n RegistryMessage copy = new RegistryMessage(this.type, this.senderId);\n copy.serviceInstance = this.serviceInstance;\n copy.serviceType = this.serviceType;\n copy.serviceId = this.serviceId;\n copy.registrySnapshot = this.registrySnapshot;\n copy.requestedServiceTypes = this.requestedServiceTypes;\n copy.syncVersion = this.syncVersion;\n copy.hopCount = this.hopCount;\n copy.visitedPeers = new HashSet<>(this.visitedPeers);\n copy.maxHops = this.maxHops;\n return copy;\n }\n \n /**\n * Checks if this message is expired based on a TTL.\n */\n public boolean isExpired(long ttlMs) {\n return System.currentTimeMillis() - timestamp > ttlMs;\n }\n \n @Override\n public boolean equals(Object o) {\n if (this == o) return true;\n if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;\n RegistryMessage that = (RegistryMessage) o;\n return Objects.equals(messageId, that.messageId);\n }\n \n @Override\n public int hashCode() {\n return Objects.hash(messageId);\n }\n \n @Override\n public String toString() {\n return \"RegistryMessage{\" +\n \"type=\" + type +\n \", senderId='\" + senderId + '\\'' +\n \", messageId='\" + messageId + '\\'' +\n \", timestamp=\" + timestamp +\n \", hopCount=\" + hopCount +\n \", Uses epidemic-style communication\n * to ensure eventual consistency across all peers.\n */\npublic class GossipProtocol {\n private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(GossipProtocol.class.getName());\n \n // Configuration constants\n private static final int DEFAULT_GOSSIP_PORT = 6003;\n private static final int DEFAULT_GOSSIP_INTERVAL_MS = 5000;\n private static final int DEFAULT_FANOUT = 3;\n private static final int DEFAULT_MESSAGE_TTL_MS = 30000;\n private static final int SOCKET_TIMEOUT_MS = 5000;\n \n private final String peerId;\n private final int gossipPort;\n private final int gossipIntervalMs;\n private final int fanout;\n private final int messageTtlMs;\n \n private final AtomicBoolean running = new AtomicBoolean(false);\n private final AtomicLong messageCounter = new AtomicLong(0);\n \n // Network components\n private ServerSocket serverSocket;\n private ExecutorService gossipExecutor;\n private ScheduledExecutorService scheduledExecutor;\n \n // Message handling\n private final Map<String, Long> seenMessages = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();\n private final BlockingQueue<RegistryMessage> outgoingMessages = new LinkedBlockingQueue<>();\n \n // Peer management\n private final Set<String> knownPeers = ConcurrentHashMap.newKeySet();\n private final Map<String, Long> peerLastSeen = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();\n \n // Message handlers\n private final Map<RegistryMessage.MessageType, MessageHandler> messageHandlers = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();\n \n /**\n * Interface for handling different types of registry messages.\n */\n public interface MessageHandler {\n void handleMessage(RegistryMessage message, String senderAddress);\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a gossip protocol instance with default configuration.\n */\n public GossipProtocol(String peerId) {\n this(peerId, DEFAULT_GOSSIP_PORT, DEFAULT_GOSSIP_INTERVAL_MS, \n DEFAULT_FANOUT, DEFAULT_MESSAGE_TTL_MS);\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a gossip protocol instance with custom configuration.\n */\n public GossipProtocol(String peerId, int gossipPort, int gossipIntervalMs, \n int fanout, int messageTtlMs) {\n this.peerId = peerId;\n this.gossipPort = gossipPort;\n this.gossipIntervalMs = gossipIntervalMs;\n this.fanout = fanout;\n this.messageTtlMs = messageTtlMs;\n }\n \n /**\n * Starts the gossip protocol.\n */\n public void start() throws IOException {\n if (running.getAndSet(true)) {\n logger.warning(\"Gossip protocol already running\");\n return;\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Starting gossip protocol for peer \" + peerId + \" on port \" + gossipPort);\n \n // Initialize thread pools\n gossipExecutor = ThreadManager.getCachedThreadPool(\n \"GossipProtocol-\" + peerId,\n \"Gossip-\" + peerId\n );\n \n scheduledExecutor = Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(2, r -> {\n Thread t = new Thread(r, \"GossipScheduler-\" + peerId);\n t.setDaemon(true);\n return t;\n });\n \n // Start server socket\n serverSocket = new ServerSocket(gossipPort);\n serverSocket.setSoTimeout(1000); // Short timeout for responsive shutdown\n \n // Start message processing threads\n startMessageListener();\n startGossipScheduler();\n startMessageCleanup();\n \n logger.info(\"Gossip protocol started successfully\");\n }\n \n /**\n * Stops the gossip protocol.\n */\n public void stop() {\n if (!running.getAndSet(false)) {\n return;\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Stopping gossip protocol for peer \" + peerId);\n \n // Close server socket\n if (serverSocket != null && !serverSocket.isClosed()) {\n try {\n serverSocket.close();\n } catch (IOException e) {\n logger.warning(\"Error closing server socket: \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }\n \n // Shutdown thread pools\n if (gossipExecutor != null) {\n gossipExecutor.shutdown();\n try {\n if (!gossipExecutor.awaitTermination(5, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {\n gossipExecutor.shutdownNow();\n }\n } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n gossipExecutor.shutdownNow();\n Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n }\n }\n \n if (scheduledExecutor != null) {\n scheduledExecutor.shutdown();\n try {\n if (!scheduledExecutor.awaitTermination(5, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {\n scheduledExecutor.shutdownNow();\n }\n } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n scheduledExecutor.shutdownNow();\n Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n }\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Gossip protocol stopped\");\n }\n \n /**\n * Broadcasts a message to the network using gossip protocol.\n */\n public void broadcast(RegistryMessage message) {\n if (!running.get()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot broadcast message: gossip protocol not running\");\n return;\n }\n \n try {\n outgoingMessages.offer(message, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS);\n messageCounter.incrementAndGet();\n logger.fine(\"Queued message for broadcast: \" + message.getType());\n } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n logger.warning(\"Interrupted while queuing message for broadcast\");\n Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Adds a known peer to the gossip network.\n */\n public void addPeer(String peerAddress) {\n knownPeers.add(peerAddress);\n peerLastSeen.put(peerAddress, System.currentTimeMillis());\n logger.fine(\"Added peer to gossip network: \" + peerAddress);\n }\n \n /**\n * Removes a peer from the gossip network.\n */\n public void removePeer(String peerAddress) {\n knownPeers.remove(peerAddress);\n peerLastSeen.remove(peerAddress);\n logger.fine(\"Removed peer from gossip network: \" + peerAddress);\n }\n \n /**\n * Registers a message handler for a specific message type.\n */\n public void registerMessageHandler(RegistryMessage.MessageType messageType, MessageHandler handler) {\n messageHandlers.put(messageType, handler);\n logger.fine(\"Registered message handler for type: \" + messageType);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets the current set of known peers.\n */\n public Set<String> getKnownPeers() {\n return new HashSet<>(knownPeers);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets gossip protocol statistics.\n */\n public Map<String, Object> getStatistics() {\n Map<String, Object> stats = new HashMap<>();\n stats.put(\"running\", running.get());\n stats.put(\"peerId\", peerId);\n stats.put(\"knownPeers\", knownPeers.size());\n stats.put(\"messagesSent\", messageCounter.get());\n stats.put(\"seenMessages\", seenMessages.size());\n stats.put(\"outgoingQueueSize\", outgoingMessages.size());\n return stats;\n }\n \n /**\n * Starts the message listener thread.\n */\n private void startMessageListener() {\n gossipExecutor.submit(() -> {\n logger.info(\"Starting gossip message listener\");\n \n while (running.get()) {\n try {\n Socket clientSocket = serverSocket.accept();\n gossipExecutor.submit(() -> handleIncomingConnection(clientSocket));\n } catch (SocketTimeoutException e) {\n // Normal timeout, continue loop\n } catch (IOException e) {\n if (running.get()) {\n logger.warning(\"Error accepting gossip connection: \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Gossip message listener stopped\");\n });\n }\n \n /**\n * Starts the gossip scheduler for periodic message propagation.\n */\n private void startGossipScheduler() {\n scheduledExecutor.scheduleWithFixedDelay(() -> {\n try {\n processOutgoingMessages();\n } catch (Exception e) {\n logger.warning(\"Error in gossip scheduler: \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }, gossipIntervalMs, gossipIntervalMs, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);\n }\n \n /**\n * Starts the message cleanup scheduler.\n */\n private void startMessageCleanup() {\n scheduledExecutor.scheduleWithFixedDelay(() -> {\n try {\n cleanupExpiredMessages();\n } catch (Exception e) {\n logger.warning(\"Error in message cleanup: \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }, messageTtlMs, messageTtlMs, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create the GossipProtocol class:

private List<String> selectGossipTargets() {\n List<String> availablePeers = new ArrayList<>(knownPeers);\n Collections.shuffle(availablePeers);\n \n int targetCount = Math.min(fanout, availablePeers.size());\n return availablePeers.subList(0, targetCount);\n }\n \n /**\n * Sends a message to a specific peer.\n */\n private void sendMessageToPeer(RegistryMessage message, String peerAddress) {\n AsyncOperationManager.executeAsync(\n \"GossipSend-\" + peerId,\n () -> {\n try {\n String[] parts = peerAddress.split(\":\");\n String host = parts[0];\n int port = parts.length > 1 ? java.util.logging.Logger;\nimport java.util.stream.Collectors;\n\n/**\n * A distributed implementation of the ServiceRegistry interface that uses\n * gossip protocol for service discovery and maintains eventual consistency\n * across multiple peers in a P2P network.\n */\npublic class DistributedServiceRegistry implements ServiceRegistry {\n private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(DistributedServiceRegistry.class.getName());\n \n private final String peerId;\n private final AtomicBoolean running = new AtomicBoolean(false);\n private final AtomicLong registryVersion = new AtomicLong(0);\n \n // Core registry storage: serviceType -> (serviceId -> ServiceInstance)\n private final Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> registry = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();\n \n // Distributed components\n private final GossipProtocol gossipProtocol;\n private final ConflictResolver conflictResolver;\n \n // Configuration\n private final int gossipPort;\n private final Set<String> bootstrapPeers;\n \n /**\n * Creates a distributed service registry with default configuration.\n */\n public DistributedServiceRegistry(String peerId) {\n this(peerId, 6003, new HashSet<>());\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates a distributed service registry with custom configuration.\n */\n public DistributedServiceRegistry(String peerId, int gossipPort, Set<String> bootstrapPeers) {\n this.peerId = peerId;\n this.gossipPort = gossipPort;\n this.bootstrapPeers = new HashSet<>(bootstrapPeers);\n \n // Initialize gossip protocol\n this.gossipProtocol = new GossipProtocol(peerId, gossipPort, 5000, 3, 30000);\n \n // Initialize conflict resolver with composite strategy\n this.conflictResolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.COMPOSITE);\n \n // Register message handlers\n setupMessageHandlers();\n }\n \n @Override\n public boolean registerService(String serviceType, String serviceId, String host, int port, \n Map<String, String> metadata) {\n if (!running.get()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot register service: registry is not running\");\n return false;\n }\n \n if (serviceType == null || serviceId == null || host == null || \n serviceType.isEmpty() || serviceId.isEmpty() || host.isEmpty() || \n port < 0 || port > 65535) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot register service: invalid parameters\");\n return false;\n }\n \n // Create versioned service instance\n long version = System.currentTimeMillis();\n ServiceInstance instance = new ServiceInstance(serviceType, serviceId, host, port, \n metadata, version, peerId);\n \n // Register locally\n Map<String, ServiceInstance> serviceMap = registry.computeIfAbsent(\n serviceType, k -> new ConcurrentHashMap<>());\n \n // Check for conflicts\n ServiceInstance existing = serviceMap.get(serviceId);\n if (existing != null) {\n // Resolve conflict\n List<ServiceInstance> conflicting = Arrays.asList(existing, instance);\n ServiceInstance resolved = conflictResolver.resolveConflict(conflicting);\n \n if (resolved.equals(existing)) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot register service: conflict resolution favored existing instance\");\n return false;\n }\n }\n \n // Add the service instance\n serviceMap.put(serviceId, instance);\n registryVersion.incrementAndGet();\n \n // Broadcast registration to network\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(peerId, instance);\n gossipProtocol.broadcast(message);\n \n logger.info(\"Registered service: \" + instance);\n return true;\n }\n \n @Override\n public boolean deregisterService(String serviceType, String serviceId) {\n if (!running.get()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot deregister service: registry is not running\");\n return false;\n }\n \n if (serviceType == null || serviceId == null || \n serviceType.isEmpty() || serviceId.isEmpty()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot deregister service: invalid parameters\");\n return false;\n }\n \n Map<String, ServiceInstance> serviceMap = registry.get(serviceType);\n if (serviceMap == null) {\n logger.fine(\"Cannot deregister service: service type not found: \" + serviceType);\n return false;\n }\n \n ServiceInstance removed = serviceMap.remove(serviceId);\n if (removed == null) {\n logger.fine(\"Cannot deregister service: service not found: \" + serviceId);\n return false;\n }\n \n // Clean up empty service type maps\n if (serviceMap.isEmpty()) {\n registry.remove(serviceType);\n }\n \n registryVersion.incrementAndGet();\n \n // Broadcast deregistration to network\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceDeregister(peerId, serviceType, serviceId);\n gossipProtocol.broadcast(message);\n \n logger.info(\"Deregistered service: \" + serviceType + \"/\" + serviceId);\n return true;\n }\n \n @Override\n public List<ServiceInstance> discoverServices(String serviceType) {\n if (!running.get()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot discover services: registry is not running\");\n return Collections.emptyList();\n }\n \n if (serviceType == null || serviceType.isEmpty()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot discover services: missing or invalid service type\");\n return Collections.emptyList();\n }\n \n Map<String, ServiceInstance> serviceMap = registry.get(serviceType);\n if (serviceMap == null) {\n logger.fine(\"No services found for type: \" + serviceType);\n return Collections.emptyList();\n }\n \n // Return only healthy services\n List<ServiceInstance> healthyServices = serviceMap.values().stream()\n .filter(ServiceInstance::isHealthy)\n .collect(Collectors.toList());\n \n logger.fine(\"Discovered \" + healthyServices.size() + \" healthy services of type: \" + serviceType);\n return new ArrayList<>(healthyServices);\n }\n \n @Override\n public ServiceInstance getService(String serviceType, String serviceId) {\n if (!running.get()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot get service: registry is not running\");\n return null;\n }\n \n if (serviceType == null || serviceId == null || \n serviceType.isEmpty() || serviceId.isEmpty()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot get service: invalid parameters\");\n return null;\n }\n \n Map<String, ServiceInstance> serviceMap = registry.get(serviceType);\n if (serviceMap == null) {\n return null;\n }\n \n return serviceMap.get(serviceId);\n }\n \n @Override\n public void start() {\n if (running.getAndSet(true)) {\n logger.warning(\"Registry already running\");\n return;\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Starting distributed service registry for peer: \" + peerId);\n \n try {\n // Start gossip protocol\n gossipProtocol.start();\n \n // Connect to bootstrap peers\n connectToBootstrapPeers();\n \n logger.info(\"Distributed service registry started successfully\");\n \n } catch (IOException e) {\n running.set(false);\n logger.severe(\"Failed to start distributed service registry: \" + e.getMessage());\n throw new RuntimeException(\"Failed to start registry\", e);\n }\n }\n \n @Override\n public void stop() {\n if (!running.getAndSet(false)) {\n return;\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Stopping distributed service registry for peer: \" + peerId);\n \n // Stop gossip protocol\n gossipProtocol.stop();\n \n // Clear registry\n registry.clear();\n \n logger.info(\"Distributed service registry stopped\");\n }\n \n @Override\n public boolean isRunning() {\n return running.get();\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets the current registry version for synchronization.\n */\n public long getRegistryVersion() {\n return registryVersion.get();\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets a snapshot of the current registry state.\n */\n public Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> getRegistrySnapshot() {\n Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> snapshot = new HashMap<>();\n registry.forEach((serviceType, serviceMap) -> {\n snapshot.put(serviceType, new HashMap<>(serviceMap));\n });\n return snapshot;\n }\n \n /**\n * Adds a peer to the gossip network.\n */\n public void addPeer(String peerAddress) {\n gossipProtocol.addPeer(peerAddress);\n }\n \n /**\n * Removes a peer from the gossip network.\n */\n public void removePeer(String peerAddress) {\n gossipProtocol.removePeer(peerAddress);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets the current set of known peers.\n */\n public Set<String> getKnownPeers() {\n return gossipProtocol.getKnownPeers();\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets registry statistics.\n */\n public Map<String, Object> getStatistics() {\n Map<String, Object> stats = new HashMap<>();\n stats.put(\"peerId\", peerId);\n stats.put(\"running\", running.get());\n stats.put(\"registryVersion\", registryVersion.get());\n stats.put(\"serviceTypes\", registry.size());\n stats.put(\"totalServices\", registry.values().stream().mapToInt(Map::size).sum());\n stats.putAll(gossipProtocol.getStatistics());\n return stats;\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create the DistributedServiceRegistry class:

This service helps recover\n * from network partitions and ensures that all peers eventually converge\n * to the same registry state.\n */\npublic class AntiEntropyService {\n private static final Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(AntiEntropyService.class.getName());\n \n // Configuration constants\n private static final int DEFAULT_RECONCILIATION_INTERVAL_MS = 60000; // 1 minute\n private static final int DEFAULT_PEER_SELECTION_COUNT = 3;\n private static final int DEFAULT_MAX_RECONCILIATION_TIME_MS = 30000; // 30 seconds\n \n private final String peerId;\n private final DistributedServiceRegistry registry;\n private final GossipProtocol gossipProtocol;\n private final ConflictResolver conflictResolver;\n \n private final int reconciliationIntervalMs;\n private final int peerSelectionCount;\n private final int maxReconciliationTimeMs;\n \n private final AtomicBoolean running = new AtomicBoolean(false);\n private final AtomicLong reconciliationCount = new AtomicLong(0);\n private final AtomicLong conflictsResolved = new AtomicLong(0);\n \n private ScheduledExecutorService scheduledExecutor;\n private ExecutorService reconciliationExecutor;\n \n // Statistics\n private final Map<String, AtomicLong> reconciliationStats = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();\n \n /**\n * Creates an anti-entropy service with default configuration.\n */\n public AntiEntropyService(String peerId, DistributedServiceRegistry registry, \n GossipProtocol gossipProtocol, ConflictResolver conflictResolver) {\n this(peerId, registry, gossipProtocol, conflictResolver,\n DEFAULT_RECONCILIATION_INTERVAL_MS, DEFAULT_PEER_SELECTION_COUNT, \n DEFAULT_MAX_RECONCILIATION_TIME_MS);\n }\n \n /**\n * Creates an anti-entropy service with custom configuration.\n */\n public AntiEntropyService(String peerId, DistributedServiceRegistry registry,\n GossipProtocol gossipProtocol, ConflictResolver conflictResolver,\n int reconciliationIntervalMs, int peerSelectionCount, \n int maxReconciliationTimeMs) {\n this.peerId = peerId;\n this.registry = registry;\n this.gossipProtocol = gossipProtocol;\n this.conflictResolver = conflictResolver;\n this.reconciliationIntervalMs = reconciliationIntervalMs;\n this.peerSelectionCount = peerSelectionCount;\n this.maxReconciliationTimeMs = maxReconciliationTimeMs;\n \n // Initialize statistics\n reconciliationStats.put(\"totalReconciliations\", new AtomicLong(0));\n reconciliationStats.put(\"successfulReconciliations\", new AtomicLong(0));\n reconciliationStats.put(\"failedReconciliations\", new AtomicLong(0));\n reconciliationStats.put(\"servicesReconciled\", new AtomicLong(0));\n reconciliationStats.put(\"conflictsDetected\", new AtomicLong(0));\n }\n \n /**\n * Starts the anti-entropy service.\n */\n public void start() {\n if (running.getAndSet(true)) {\n logger.warning(\"Anti-entropy service already running\");\n return;\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Starting anti-entropy service for peer: \" + peerId);\n \n // Initialize thread pools\n scheduledExecutor = Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(1, r -> {\n Thread t = new Thread(r, \"AntiEntropy-Scheduler-\" + peerId);\n t.setDaemon(true);\n return t;\n });\n \n reconciliationExecutor = ThreadManager.getCachedThreadPool(\n \"AntiEntropy-\" + peerId,\n \"AntiEntropyWorker-\" + peerId\n );\n \n // Schedule periodic reconciliation\n scheduledExecutor.scheduleWithFixedDelay(\n this::performReconciliation,\n reconciliationIntervalMs,\n reconciliationIntervalMs,\n TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS\n );\n \n logger.info(\"Anti-entropy service started successfully\");\n }\n \n /**\n * Stops the anti-entropy service.\n */\n public void stop() {\n if (!running.getAndSet(false)) {\n return;\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Stopping anti-entropy service for peer: \" + peerId);\n \n // Shutdown schedulers\n if (scheduledExecutor != null) {\n scheduledExecutor.shutdown();\n try {\n if (!scheduledExecutor.awaitTermination(5, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {\n scheduledExecutor.shutdownNow();\n }\n } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n scheduledExecutor.shutdownNow();\n Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n }\n }\n \n if (reconciliationExecutor != null) {\n reconciliationExecutor.shutdown();\n try {\n if (!reconciliationExecutor.awaitTermination(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {\n reconciliationExecutor.shutdownNow();\n }\n } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n reconciliationExecutor.shutdownNow();\n Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n }\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Anti-entropy service stopped\");\n }\n \n /**\n * Performs a reconciliation cycle with selected peers.\n */\n private void performReconciliation() {\n if (!running.get()) {\n return;\n }\n \n try {\n reconciliationStats.get(\"totalReconciliations\").incrementAndGet();\n reconciliationCount.incrementAndGet();\n \n logger.fine(\"Starting reconciliation cycle #\" + reconciliationCount.get());\n \n // Select peers for reconciliation\n Set<String> selectedPeers = selectPeersForReconciliation();\n \n if (selectedPeers.isEmpty()) {\n logger.fine(\"No peers available for reconciliation\");\n return;\n }\n \n // Perform reconciliation with selected peers\n List<CompletableFuture<Void>> reconciliationTasks = new ArrayList<>();\n \n for (String peerAddress : selectedPeers) {\n CompletableFuture<Void> task = CompletableFuture.runAsync(\n () -> reconcileWithPeer(peerAddress),\n reconciliationExecutor\n ).orTimeout(maxReconciliationTimeMs, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);\n \n reconciliationTasks.add(task);\n }\n \n // Wait for all reconciliation tasks to complete\n CompletableFuture<Void> allTasks = CompletableFuture.allOf(\n reconciliationTasks.toArray(new CompletableFuture[0])\n );\n \n allTasks.whenComplete((result, throwable) -> {\n if (throwable != null) {\n reconciliationStats.get(\"failedReconciliations\").incrementAndGet();\n logger.warning(\"Reconciliation cycle failed: \" + throwable.getMessage());\n } else {\n reconciliationStats.get(\"successfulReconciliations\").incrementAndGet();\n logger.fine(\"Reconciliation cycle completed successfully\");\n }\n });\n \n } catch (Exception e) {\n reconciliationStats.get(\"failedReconciliations\").incrementAndGet();\n logger.warning(\"Error in reconciliation cycle: \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Selects peers for reconciliation using a random selection strategy.\n */\n private Set<String> selectPeersForReconciliation() {\n Set<String> knownPeers = gossipProtocol.getKnownPeers();\n \n if (knownPeers.isEmpty()) {\n return Collections.emptySet();\n }\n \n List<String> peerList = new ArrayList<>(knownPeers);\n Collections.shuffle(peerList);\n \n int selectionCount = Math.min(peerSelectionCount, peerList.size());\n return new HashSet<>(peerList.subList(0, selectionCount));\n }\n \n /**\n * Performs reconciliation with a specific peer.\n */\n private void reconcileWithPeer(String peerAddress) {\n try {\n logger.fine(\"Starting reconciliation with peer: \" + peerAddress);\n \n // Get current registry snapshot\n Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> localSnapshot = registry.getRegistrySnapshot();\n \n // Create anti-entropy message with our registry state\n RegistryMessage antiEntropyMessage = RegistryMessage.createAntiEntropy(peerId, localSnapshot);\n \n // Send anti-entropy message to peer\n // Note: This would need to be implemented as a direct send method in GossipProtocol\n // For now, we'll use the broadcast mechanism\n gossipProtocol.broadcast(antiEntropyMessage);\n \n // Request peer's registry state\n RegistryMessage syncRequest = RegistryMessage.createSyncRequest(peerId, Collections.emptySet());\n gossipProtocol.broadcast(syncRequest);\n \n logger.fine(\"Reconciliation initiated with peer: \" + peerAddress);\n \n } catch (Exception e) {\n logger.warning(\"Error reconciling with peer \" + peerAddress + \": \" + e.getMessage());\n }\n }\n \n /**\n * Manually triggers a reconciliation cycle.\n */\n public void triggerReconciliation() {\n if (!running.get()) {\n logger.warning(\"Cannot trigger reconciliation: service not running\");\n return;\n }\n \n logger.info(\"Manually triggering reconciliation cycle\");\n reconciliationExecutor.submit(this::performReconciliation);\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets anti-entropy service statistics.\n */\n public Map<String, Object> getStatistics() {\n Map<String, Object> stats = new HashMap<>();\n stats.put(\"running\", running.get());\n stats.put(\"peerId\", peerId);\n stats.put(\"reconciliationCount\", reconciliationCount.get());\n stats.put(\"conflictsResolved\", conflictsResolved.get());\n stats.put(\"reconciliationIntervalMs\", reconciliationIntervalMs);\n stats.put(\"peerSelectionCount\", peerSelectionCount);\n \n // Add detailed statistics\n reconciliationStats.forEach((key, value) -> stats.put(key, value.get()));\n \n return stats;\n }\n \n /**\n * Checks if the service is running.\n */\n public boolean isRunning() {\n return running.get();\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets the current reconciliation count.\n */\n public long getReconciliationCount() {\n return reconciliationCount.get();\n }\n \n /**\n * Gets the number of conflicts resolved.\n */\n public long getConflictsResolved() {\n return conflictsResolved.get();\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create the AntiEntropyService for periodic reconciliation:

"p2p-discovery/src/test/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery/ConflictResolverTest.java", "file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery;\n\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;\n\nimport java.util.*;\n\nimport static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;\n\n/**\n * Unit tests for the ConflictResolver class.\n * Tests various conflict resolution strategies and edge cases.\n */\npublic class ConflictResolverTest {\n\n private ConflictResolver resolver;\n private ServiceInstance instance1;\n private ServiceInstance instance2;\n private ServiceInstance instance3;\n\n @BeforeEach\n void setUp() {\n // Create test service instances with different versions and origins\n instance1 = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"service-1\", \"host1\", 8080, \n null, 1000L, \"peer1\");\n instance2 = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"service-1\", \"host2\", 8081, \n null, 2000L, \"peer2\");\n instance3 = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"service-1\", \"host3\", 8082, \n null, 1500L, \"peer3\");\n \n // Set different health statuses\n instance1.setHealthy(true);\n instance2.setHealthy(false);\n instance3.setHealthy(true);\n }\n\n @Test\n void testLastWriteWinsStrategy() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.LAST_WRITE_WINS);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> conflicting = Arrays.asList(instance1, instance2, instance3);\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(conflicting);\n \n // Should select instance2 as it has the highest version (2000L)\n assertEquals(instance2, resolved);\n assertEquals(2000L, resolved.getVersion());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testOriginPriorityStrategy() {\n Set<String> priorityPeers = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\"peer1\", \"peer3\"));\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.ORIGIN_PRIORITY, priorityPeers);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> conflicting = Arrays.asList(instance1, instance2, instance3);\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(conflicting);\n \n // Should select instance3 as it's from a priority peer and has higher version than instance1\n assertEquals(instance3, resolved);\n assertEquals(\"peer3\", resolved.getOriginPeerId());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testOriginPriorityFallbackToLastWrite() {\n Set<String> priorityPeers = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\"peer4\", \"peer5\")); // No matching peers\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.ORIGIN_PRIORITY, priorityPeers);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> conflicting = Arrays.asList(instance1, instance2, instance3);\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(conflicting);\n \n // Should fall back to last write wins and select instance2\n assertEquals(instance2, resolved);\n assertEquals(2000L, resolved.getVersion());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testHealthPriorityStrategy() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.HEALTH_PRIORITY);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> conflicting = Arrays.asList(instance1, instance2, instance3);\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(conflicting);\n \n // Should select instance3 as it's healthy and has higher version than instance1\n assertEquals(instance3, resolved);\n assertTrue(resolved.isHealthy());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testHealthPriorityWithOnlyUnhealthyInstances() {\n // Make all instances unhealthy\n instance1.setHealthy(false);\n instance2.setHealthy(false);\n instance3.setHealthy(false);\n \n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.HEALTH_PRIORITY);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> conflicting = Arrays.asList(instance1, instance2, instance3);\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(conflicting);\n \n // Should fall back to last write wins and select instance2\n assertEquals(instance2, resolved);\n assertFalse(resolved.isHealthy());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCompositeStrategy() {\n Set<String> priorityPeers = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\"peer1\"));\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.COMPOSITE, priorityPeers);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> conflicting = Arrays.asList(instance1, instance2, instance3);\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(conflicting);\n \n // Should select instance1: it's healthy and from a priority peer\n assertEquals(instance1, resolved);\n assertTrue(resolved.isHealthy());\n assertEquals(\"peer1\", resolved.getOriginPeerId());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCompositeStrategyWithUnhealthyPriorityPeer() {\n // Make priority peer instance unhealthy\n instance1.setHealthy(false);\n \n Set<String> priorityPeers = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\"peer1\"));\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.COMPOSITE, priorityPeers);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> conflicting = Arrays.asList(instance1, instance2, instance3);\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(conflicting);\n \n // Should select instance3: it's healthy (instance2 is unhealthy)\n assertEquals(instance3, resolved);\n assertTrue(resolved.isHealthy());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testResolveConflictWithSingleInstance() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.LAST_WRITE_WINS);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> single = Arrays.asList(instance1);\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(single);\n \n assertEquals(instance1, resolved);\n }\n\n @Test\n void testResolveConflictWithEmptyList() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.LAST_WRITE_WINS);\n \n List<ServiceInstance> empty = Collections.emptyList();\n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(empty);\n \n assertNull(resolved);\n }\n\n @Test\n void testResolveConflictWithNullList() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.LAST_WRITE_WINS);\n \n ServiceInstance resolved = resolver.resolveConflict(null);\n \n assertNull(resolved);\n }\n\n @Test\n void testIsConflict() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.LAST_WRITE_WINS);\n \n // Same service ID but different versions should be a conflict\n assertTrue(resolver.isConflict(instance1, instance2));\n \n // Same service ID but different hosts should be a conflict\n ServiceInstance sameVersion = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"service-1\", \"host1\", 8080, \n null, 1000L, \"peer1\");\n ServiceInstance differentHost = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"service-1\", \"different-host\", 8080, \n null, 1000L, \"peer1\");\n assertTrue(resolver.isConflict(sameVersion, differentHost));\n \n // Different service IDs should not be a conflict\n ServiceInstance differentId = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"different-id\", \"host1\", 8080, \n null, 1000L, \"peer1\");\n assertFalse(resolver.isConflict(instance1, differentId));\n \n // Null instances should not be a conflict\n assertFalse(resolver.isConflict(null, instance1));\n assertFalse(resolver.isConflict(instance1, null));\n assertFalse(resolver.isConflict(null, null));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testMergeMetadata() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.LAST_WRITE_WINS);\n \n // Create instances with different metadata\n Map<String, String> metadata1 = new HashMap<>();\n metadata1.put(\"version\", \"1.0\");\n metadata1.put(\"env\", \"test\");\n \n Map<String, String> metadata2 = new HashMap<>();\n metadata2.put(\"version\", \"2.0\");\n metadata2.put(\"region\", \"us-east\");\n \n ServiceInstance withMetadata1 = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"service-1\", \"host1\", 8080, \n metadata1, 1000L, \"peer1\");\n ServiceInstance withMetadata2 = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"service-1\", \"host2\", 8081, \n metadata2, 2000L, \"peer2\");\n \n List<ServiceInstance> instances = Arrays.asList(withMetadata1, withMetadata2);\n Map<String, String> merged = resolver.mergeMetadata(instances);\n \n // Should have all keys, with newer values taking precedence\n assertEquals(\"2.0\", merged.get(\"version\")); // Newer version\n assertEquals(\"test\", merged.get(\"env\")); // Only in older instance\n assertEquals(\"us-east\", merged.get(\"region\")); // Only in newer instance\n }\n\n @Test\n void testPriorityPeerManagement() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.ORIGIN_PRIORITY);\n \n // Initially no priority peers\n assertTrue(resolver.getPriorityPeers().isEmpty());\n \n // Add priority peers\n resolver.addPriorityPeer(\"peer1\");\n resolver.addPriorityPeer(\"peer2\");\n \n Set<String> priorityPeers = resolver.getPriorityPeers();\n assertEquals(2, priorityPeers.size());\n assertTrue(priorityPeers.contains(\"peer1\"));\n assertTrue(priorityPeers.contains(\"peer2\"));\n \n // Remove priority peer\n resolver.removePriorityPeer(\"peer1\");\n priorityPeers = resolver.getPriorityPeers();\n assertEquals(1, priorityPeers.size());\n assertTrue(priorityPeers.contains(\"peer2\"));\n assertFalse(priorityPeers.contains(\"peer1\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testGetStrategy() {\n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.HEALTH_PRIORITY);\n assertEquals(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.HEALTH_PRIORITY, resolver.getStrategy());\n \n resolver = new ConflictResolver(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.COMPOSITE);\n assertEquals(ConflictResolver.ResolutionStrategy.COMPOSITE, resolver.getStrategy());\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create comprehensive tests for the new distributed registry components. "p2p-discovery/src/test/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery/RegistryMessageTest.java", "file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery;\n\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;\n\nimport java.util.*;\n\nimport static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;\n\n/**\n * Unit tests for the RegistryMessage class.\n * Tests message creation, gossip protocol functionality, and serialization.\n */\npublic class RegistryMessageTest {\n\n private ServiceInstance testService;\n private String senderId;\n private Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> testSnapshot;\n\n @BeforeEach\n void setUp() {\n senderId = \"test-peer-1\";\n testService = new ServiceInstance(\"test-service\", \"service-1\", \"localhost\", 8080, \n null, 1000L, senderId);\n \n // Create test registry snapshot\n testSnapshot = new HashMap<>();\n Map<String, ServiceInstance> serviceMap = new HashMap<>();\n serviceMap.put(\"service-1\", testService);\n testSnapshot.put(\"test-service\", serviceMap);\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCreateServiceRegister() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n \n assertEquals(RegistryMessage.MessageType.SERVICE_REGISTER, message.getType());\n assertEquals(senderId, message.getSenderId());\n assertEquals(testService, message.getServiceInstance());\n assertEquals(\"test-service\", message.getServiceType());\n assertEquals(\"service-1\", message.getServiceId());\n assertNotNull(message.getMessageId());\n assertTrue(message.getTimestamp() > 0);\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCreateServiceDeregister() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceDeregister(senderId, \"test-service\", \"service-1\");\n \n assertEquals(RegistryMessage.MessageType.SERVICE_DEREGISTER, message.getType());\n assertEquals(senderId, message.getSenderId());\n assertEquals(\"test-service\", message.getServiceType());\n assertEquals(\"service-1\", message.getServiceId());\n assertNull(message.getServiceInstance());\n assertNotNull(message.getMessageId());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCreateServiceUpdate() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceUpdate(senderId, testService);\n \n assertEquals(RegistryMessage.MessageType.SERVICE_UPDATE, message.getType());\n assertEquals(senderId, message.getSenderId());\n assertEquals(testService, message.getServiceInstance());\n assertEquals(\"test-service\", message.getServiceType());\n assertEquals(\"service-1\", message.getServiceId());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCreateSyncRequest() {\n Set<String> requestedTypes = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\"service-type-1\", \"service-type-2\"));\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createSyncRequest(senderId, requestedTypes);\n \n assertEquals(RegistryMessage.MessageType.SYNC_REQUEST, message.getType());\n assertEquals(senderId, message.getSenderId());\n assertEquals(requestedTypes, message.getRequestedServiceTypes());\n assertNull(message.getServiceInstance());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCreateSyncResponse() {\n long syncVersion = 12345L;\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createSyncResponse(senderId, testSnapshot, syncVersion);\n \n assertEquals(RegistryMessage.MessageType.SYNC_RESPONSE, message.getType());\n assertEquals(senderId, message.getSenderId());\n assertEquals(testSnapshot, message.getRegistrySnapshot());\n assertEquals(syncVersion, message.getSyncVersion());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCreateHeartbeat() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createHeartbeat(senderId, testService);\n \n assertEquals(RegistryMessage.MessageType.HEARTBEAT, message.getType());\n assertEquals(senderId, message.getSenderId());\n assertEquals(testService, message.getServiceInstance());\n assertEquals(\"test-service\", message.getServiceType());\n assertEquals(\"service-1\", message.getServiceId());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testCreateAntiEntropy() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createAntiEntropy(senderId, testSnapshot);\n \n assertEquals(RegistryMessage.MessageType.ANTI_ENTROPY, message.getType());\n assertEquals(senderId, message.getSenderId());\n assertEquals(testSnapshot, message.getRegistrySnapshot());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testGossipProtocolMethods() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n \n // Initial state\n assertEquals(0, message.getHopCount());\n assertEquals(5, message.getMaxHops()); // Default max hops\n assertTrue(message.canPropagate());\n assertFalse(message.hasVisited(\"peer-1\"));\n assertTrue(message.getVisitedPeers().isEmpty());\n \n // Increment hop\n RegistryMessage propagated = message.incrementHop(\"peer-1\");\n assertEquals(1, propagated.getHopCount());\n assertTrue(propagated.hasVisited(\"peer-1\"));\n assertEquals(1, propagated.getVisitedPeers().size());\n assertTrue(propagated.canPropagate());\n \n // Original message should be unchanged\n assertEquals(0, message.getHopCount());\n assertFalse(message.hasVisited(\"peer-1\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testMaxHopsReached() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n message.setMaxHops(2);\n \n // First hop\n RegistryMessage hop1 = message.incrementHop(\"peer-1\");\n assertTrue(hop1.canPropagate());\n \n // Second hop (at max)\n RegistryMessage hop2 = hop1.incrementHop(\"peer-2\");\n assertFalse(hop2.canPropagate());\n assertEquals(2, hop2.getHopCount());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testSetMaxHops() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n \n message.setMaxHops(10);\n assertEquals(10, message.getMaxHops());\n \n // Should not allow max hops less than 1\n message.setMaxHops(0);\n assertEquals(1, message.getMaxHops());\n \n message.setMaxHops(-5);\n assertEquals(1, message.getMaxHops());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testIsExpired() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n \n // Should not be expired immediately\n assertFalse(message.isExpired(1000));\n \n // Should be expired with very short TTL\n assertTrue(message.isExpired(0));\n \n // Wait a bit and test with short TTL\n try {\n Thread.sleep(10);\n } catch (InterruptedException e) {\n Thread.currentThread().interrupt();\n }\n assertTrue(message.isExpired(5));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testMessageEquality() {\n RegistryMessage message1 = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n RegistryMessage message2 = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n \n // Different messages should not be equal (different message IDs)\n assertNotEquals(message1, message2);\n assertNotEquals(message1.hashCode(), message2.hashCode());\n \n // Same message should be equal to itself\n assertEquals(message1, message1);\n assertEquals(message1.hashCode(), message1.hashCode());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testMessageToString() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n String toString = message.toString();\n \n assertTrue(toString.contains(\"SERVICE_REGISTER\"));\n assertTrue(toString.contains(senderId));\n assertTrue(toString.contains(\"test-service\"));\n assertTrue(toString.contains(\"service-1\"));\n assertTrue(toString.contains(message.getMessageId()));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testRegistrySnapshotImmutability() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createSyncResponse(senderId, testSnapshot, 1000L);\n \n Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> retrievedSnapshot = message.getRegistrySnapshot();\n assertNotNull(retrievedSnapshot);\n \n // Modifying the retrieved snapshot should not affect the original\n retrievedSnapshot.clear();\n \n // Get snapshot again - should still contain original data\n Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> freshSnapshot = message.getRegistrySnapshot();\n assertFalse(freshSnapshot.isEmpty());\n assertTrue(freshSnapshot.containsKey(\"test-service\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testRequestedServiceTypesImmutability() {\n Set<String> requestedTypes = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\"type1\", \"type2\"));\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createSyncRequest(senderId, requestedTypes);\n \n Set<String> retrievedTypes = message.getRequestedServiceTypes();\n assertNotNull(retrievedTypes);\n assertEquals(2, retrievedTypes.size());\n \n // Modifying the retrieved set should not affect the original\n retrievedTypes.clear();\n \n // Get types again - should still contain original data\n Set<String> freshTypes = message.getRequestedServiceTypes();\n assertEquals(2, freshTypes.size());\n assertTrue(freshTypes.contains(\"type1\"));\n assertTrue(freshTypes.contains(\"type2\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testVisitedPeersImmutability() {\n RegistryMessage message = RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, testService);\n RegistryMessage propagated = message.incrementHop(\"peer-1\");\n \n Set<String> visitedPeers = propagated.getVisitedPeers();\n assertNotNull(visitedPeers);\n assertEquals(1, visitedPeers.size());\n \n // Modifying the retrieved set should not affect the original\n visitedPeers.clear();\n \n // Get visited peers again - should still contain original data\n Set<String> freshVisited = propagated.getVisitedPeers();\n assertEquals(1, freshVisited.size());\n assertTrue(freshVisited.contains(\"peer-1\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testNullHandling() {\n // Test with null service instance\n assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> {\n RegistryMessage.createServiceRegister(senderId, null);\n });\n \n // Test with null requested service types\n RegistryMessage syncRequest = RegistryMessage.createSyncRequest(senderId, null);\n assertNull(syncRequest.getRequestedServiceTypes());\n \n // Test with null registry snapshot\n RegistryMessage syncResponse = RegistryMessage.createSyncResponse(senderId, null, 1000L);\n assertNull(syncResponse.getRegistrySnapshot());\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create tests for the RegistryMessage class:

"p2p-discovery/src/test/java/dev/mars/p2pjava/discovery/DistributedServiceRegistryTest.java", "file_content": "package dev.mars.p2pjava.discovery;\n\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach;\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;\nimport org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;\n\nimport java.util.*;\nimport java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;\nimport java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;\n\nimport static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;\n\n/**\n * Integration tests for the DistributedServiceRegistry class.\n * Tests basic functionality and distributed behavior.\n */\npublic class DistributedServiceRegistryTest {\n\n private DistributedServiceRegistry registry1;\n private DistributedServiceRegistry registry2;\n private static final String TEST_SERVICE_TYPE = \"test-service\";\n private static final String TEST_SERVICE_ID = \"test-service-1\";\n private static final String TEST_HOST = \"localhost\";\n private static final int TEST_PORT = 8080;\n\n @BeforeEach\n void setUp() {\n // Create two registry instances with different gossip ports\n registry1 = new DistributedServiceRegistry(\"peer1\", 6010, Collections.emptySet());\n registry2 = new DistributedServiceRegistry(\"peer2\", 6011, Collections.emptySet());\n }\n\n @AfterEach\n void tearDown() {\n if (registry1 != null && registry1.isRunning()) {\n registry1.stop();\n }\n if (registry2 != null && registry2.isRunning()) {\n registry2.stop();\n }\n }\n\n @Test\n void testBasicServiceRegistration() {\n registry1.start();\n \n assertTrue(registry1.isRunning());\n \n // Register a service\n boolean registered = registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null);\n assertTrue(registered, \"Service registration should succeed\");\n \n // Discover the service\n List<ServiceInstance> services = registry1.discoverServices(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE);\n assertNotNull(services);\n assertEquals(1, services.size());\n \n ServiceInstance service = services.get(0);\n assertEquals(TEST_SERVICE_ID, service.getServiceId());\n assertEquals(TEST_HOST, service.getHost());\n assertEquals(TEST_PORT, service.getPort());\n assertEquals(\"peer1\", service.getOriginPeerId());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testServiceDeregistration() {\n registry1.start();\n \n // Register a service\n registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null);\n \n // Verify it's registered\n List<ServiceInstance> services = registry1.discoverServices(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE);\n assertEquals(1, services.size());\n \n // Deregister the service\n boolean deregistered = registry1.deregisterService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID);\n assertTrue(deregistered, \"Service deregistration should succeed\");\n \n // Verify it's gone\n services = registry1.discoverServices(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE);\n assertTrue(services.isEmpty());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testGetService() {\n registry1.start();\n \n // Register a service\n registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null);\n \n // Get the specific service\n ServiceInstance service = registry1.getService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID);\n assertNotNull(service);\n assertEquals(TEST_SERVICE_ID, service.getServiceId());\n assertEquals(TEST_HOST, service.getHost());\n assertEquals(TEST_PORT, service.getPort());\n \n // Try to get non-existent service\n ServiceInstance nonExistent = registry1.getService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, \"non-existent\");\n assertNull(nonExistent);\n }\n\n @Test\n void testRegistryVersionIncrement() {\n registry1.start();\n \n long initialVersion = registry1.getRegistryVersion();\n \n // Register a service - should increment version\n registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null);\n assertTrue(registry1.getRegistryVersion() > initialVersion);\n \n long afterRegister = registry1.getRegistryVersion();\n \n // Deregister the service - should increment version again\n registry1.deregisterService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID);\n assertTrue(registry1.getRegistryVersion() > afterRegister);\n }\n\n @Test\n void testRegistrySnapshot() {\n registry1.start();\n \n // Register multiple services\n registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null);\n registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, \"service-2\", TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT + 1, null);\n registry1.registerService(\"another-service\", \"service-3\", TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT + 2, null);\n \n Map<String, Map<String, ServiceInstance>> snapshot = registry1.getRegistrySnapshot();\n \n assertNotNull(snapshot);\n assertEquals(2, snapshot.size()); // Two service types\n assertTrue(snapshot.containsKey(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE));\n assertTrue(snapshot.containsKey(\"another-service\"));\n \n Map<String, ServiceInstance> testServices = snapshot.get(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE);\n assertEquals(2, testServices.size());\n assertTrue(testServices.containsKey(TEST_SERVICE_ID));\n assertTrue(testServices.containsKey(\"service-2\"));\n \n Map<String, ServiceInstance> anotherServices = snapshot.get(\"another-service\");\n assertEquals(1, anotherServices.size());\n assertTrue(anotherServices.containsKey(\"service-3\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testPeerManagement() {\n registry1.start();\n \n // Initially no known peers\n Set<String> knownPeers = registry1.getKnownPeers();\n assertTrue(knownPeers.isEmpty());\n \n // Add a peer\n registry1.addPeer(\"peer2:6011\");\n knownPeers = registry1.getKnownPeers();\n assertEquals(1, knownPeers.size());\n assertTrue(knownPeers.contains(\"peer2:6011\"));\n \n // Remove the peer\n registry1.removePeer(\"peer2:6011\");\n knownPeers = registry1.getKnownPeers();\n assertTrue(knownPeers.isEmpty());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testStatistics() {\n registry1.start();\n \n Map<String, Object> stats = registry1.getStatistics();\n \n assertNotNull(stats);\n assertEquals(\"peer1\", stats.get(\"peerId\"));\n assertEquals(true, stats.get(\"running\"));\n assertTrue(stats.containsKey(\"registryVersion\"));\n assertTrue(stats.containsKey(\"serviceTypes\"));\n assertTrue(stats.containsKey(\"totalServices\"));\n \n // Register a service and check stats update\n registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null);\n \n stats = registry1.getStatistics();\n assertEquals(1, stats.get(\"serviceTypes\"));\n assertEquals(1, stats.get(\"totalServices\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testInvalidParameters() {\n registry1.start();\n \n // Test invalid service registration\n assertFalse(registry1.registerService(null, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null));\n assertFalse(registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, null, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null));\n assertFalse(registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, null, TEST_PORT, null));\n assertFalse(registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, \"\", TEST_PORT, null));\n assertFalse(registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, -1, null));\n assertFalse(registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, 70000, null));\n \n // Test invalid service deregistration\n assertFalse(registry1.deregisterService(null, TEST_SERVICE_ID));\n assertFalse(registry1.deregisterService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, null));\n assertFalse(registry1.deregisterService(\"\", TEST_SERVICE_ID));\n assertFalse(registry1.deregisterService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, \"\"));\n \n // Test invalid service discovery\n assertTrue(registry1.discoverServices(null).isEmpty());\n assertTrue(registry1.discoverServices(\"\").isEmpty());\n \n // Test invalid service retrieval\n assertNull(registry1.getService(null, TEST_SERVICE_ID));\n assertNull(registry1.getService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, null));\n assertNull(registry1.getService(\"\", TEST_SERVICE_ID));\n assertNull(registry1.getService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, \"\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testOperationsWhenNotRunning() {\n // Registry not started\n assertFalse(registry1.isRunning());\n \n // Operations should fail when not running\n assertFalse(registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, null));\n assertFalse(registry1.deregisterService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID));\n assertTrue(registry1.discoverServices(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE).isEmpty());\n assertNull(registry1.getService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testStartStop() {\n assertFalse(registry1.isRunning());\n \n // Start the registry\n registry1.start();\n assertTrue(registry1.isRunning());\n \n // Starting again should not cause issues\n registry1.start(); // Should log warning but not fail\n assertTrue(registry1.isRunning());\n \n // Stop the registry\n registry1.stop();\n assertFalse(registry1.isRunning());\n \n // Stopping again should not cause issues\n registry1.stop(); // Should return immediately\n assertFalse(registry1.isRunning());\n }\n\n @Test\n void testServiceWithMetadata() {\n registry1.start();\n \n Map<String, String> metadata = new HashMap<>();\n metadata.put(\"version\", \"1.0\");\n metadata.put(\"environment\", \"test\");\n \n // Register service with metadata\n boolean registered = registry1.registerService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID, TEST_HOST, TEST_PORT, metadata);\n assertTrue(registered);\n \n // Retrieve and verify metadata\n ServiceInstance service = registry1.getService(TEST_SERVICE_TYPE, TEST_SERVICE_ID);\n assertNotNull(service);\n \n Map<String, String> retrievedMetadata = service.getMetadata();\n assertEquals(\"1.0\", retrievedMetadata.get(\"version\"));\n assertEquals(\"test\", retrievedMetadata.get(\"environment\"));\n }\n\n @Test\n void testMultipleServiceTypes() {\n registry1.start();\n \n // Register services of different types\n registry1.registerService(\"type1\", \"service1\", TEST_HOST, 8080, null);\n registry1.registerService(\"type1\", \"service2\", TEST_HOST, 8081, null);\n registry1.registerService(\"type2\", \"service3\", TEST_HOST, 8082, null);\n \n // Discover services by type\n List<ServiceInstance> type1Services = registry1.discoverServices(\"type1\");\n assertEquals(2, type1Services.size());\n \n List<ServiceInstance> type2Services = registry1.discoverServices(\"type2\");\n assertEquals(1, type2Services.size());\n \n List<ServiceInstance> nonExistentServices = registry1.discoverServices(\"type3\");\n assertTrue(nonExistentServices.isEmpty());\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a basic integration test for the
